This is the beginning of the tutorial segment.

There may seem like there are a lot of rules up ahead (and there are!) but we'll attempt to walk you slowly through it.

Let's practice the basics then.

This is the start of a Dream and you're looking down at a bird's eye view map of the area around you.

Each MAP TILE consists of four spaces .

Map Tile Place your Dreamer miniatures in start (Dreamer's Entrance) spaces.

As the start symbol straddles two spaces, you may choose either of them .

A space can contain at most 4 figures - these are combinations of Dreamer miniatures and/or other miniatures.

A TURN will consist of a DREAMERS PHASE where all Dreamers will draw up to 4 INFLUENCE CARDS from their Influence Deck to their maximum hand size which is typically 6 , followed by a DREAMSCAPE PHASE (more on that later).

So for example, if you had 3 cards in your hand already at the beginning of the Dreamers Phase you would only draw 3 cards, which brings you to your hand size of 6 cards.

Similarly if you had 4 cards, you would only draw 2 cards.

Before you draw you may discard any number of cards.

However you have no cards in your hand at the moment so DRAW 4 INFLUENCE CARDS NOW.

Now let's look around the map.

You see 3 pedestals dotted around the Dreamscape tile you're on and on each one you will practice different actions that make up most of the different types of map actions that may appear throughout the game.

Oh but we forgot one thing haven't we? How do you get to these spaces first? If you look at your hand of cards now you'll notice on the top left they will have a bunch of symbols, namely yellow , red , green .

These represent your Dreamer's inner resources or INTENT to deal with problems: yellow is your CUNNING and is mainly related to movement, avoidance, cleverness and deception.

green is your AWARENESS and is mainly related to diplomacy, conversation, observation, understanding and aptitude with technology.

red is your WRATH and is mainly related to physical actions, fighting, tenacity and argument.

Movement Now to move you will need to discard influence cards with yellow intent on them - one intent for each space of movement.

So if you wanted to move your Dreamer 3 spaces you could discard one influence card with 2 yellow intent and another one with 1 yellow intent.

These cards go to a personal discard pile (you can keep these face up on the right side of your Dreamer Board) and you get to move your Dreamer miniature to the intended space.

Remember that you cannot normally move diagonally .

If you decide to move less than the number of intent you spent - this is possible also, but any excess intent is lost.

In fact with any of your actions, if you overspend, any excess influence is lost.

Now back to the MAP ACTIONS...

Green action The green one is a simple action with a cost of 6 green .

To pay for this you will need to be on this space and then discard Influence cards from your hand for Intent - specifically cards with green icons in their top left.

So I might discard 2 cards with 2 green each (for a total of 4) and 2 more cards with green each (for a total of 2) to make up this cost.

This all has to be paid in the one action by only one Dreamer .

You may find that you need to keep cards from turn to turn in order to have enough intent to pay for this.

Once the cost has been paid, you read the relevant entry in the Secret Script.

Yellow action The yellow one is an action for 3 yellow but you have to pay it as many times as the number of Dreamers (that's what player-x means) in gradual increments .

We call these gradual actions and they are only resolved once the full cost has been met.

As before you also need to be on this space to pay the costs.

So for example if there are 2 Dreamers playing, the total cost of activating the space is 2 player x 3 yellow = 6 yellow intent.

This can be paid all at once in a single action OR progressively over multiple TURNS in increments of 3 yellow intent, with each payment tracked by a yellow-marker (Yellow marker) placed on the space of the action.

To illustrate this, on one turn, the Free Spirit might pay 3 yellow intent first to contribute to this (by discarding 3 yellow intent worth of cards from her hand).

You place a yellow-marker on the space to represent this.

Then on another turn, the Tough Guy , can contribute another 3 yellow to complete the action, reading from the relevant script.

Alternatively if you just had 6 yellow intent you could pay it outright and complete the action.

Red action The red one is an Assault action with a cost of 6 red (representing wrath thematically).

This special type of action can be performed at a range of 1 (the space itself or an adjacent space but not diagonally ).

One action which hasn't been featured on this map is the Contact action which is very similar to the Assault action but uses green intent instead and also has an action range of 1 .

Some of your card abilities will only work with Assault or Contact actions.

Sometimes you might run into actions with "red" or "green" words but if they do not mention specifically Assault or Contact they are not these actions.

Additionally, the actions on the yellow and red pedestals have a block icon, which means that they are one-use only – when performed, place a block token on them to mark that they are no longer available.

Gem action There is another action in the lower-left corner of the A2 tile .

This one allows you to gain 1 gem (shining blue gem) for 1 green intent.

The only limit to how many times you may perform it is the number of gem available ( 6 ) – treat yourself to all the gem if you like but this might mean that other Dreamers don't have access to them (if you're playing with others).

What are gem used for? You may use them to reroll any die .

Why might you want to roll the di(c)e in the first place? See - s.450.3 - BOOSTING INTENT.

Free action In the lower-right corner, there is a free action (with a cost of zero ) – you only have to be in this space to use it.

There is also a wall close-by - this is an impassable barrier that you can't move through or measure range through.

wall You'll also note that some of your cards have abilities on the bottom of them that can be used to pay for Intent.

These abilities typically allow you to obtain Intent more efficiently.

To read more about how to use card abilities, go to - s.450.1 .

Note that there is no set action structure, so feel to take your actions simultaneously to save time - that is, if you're playing with multiple players.

When you've run out of things to do (or cards in your hands), all Dreamers will pass and you'll move into the DREAMSCAPE PHASE - go to - s.450.4 .

As this script is a condensed summary of all the rules of the games（with quick links below), we recommend that you write this number (450) down somewhere in case you need to reference it again during play.

We may make a glossary of rules soon, maybe? Using map actions - s.450 Using card effects/abilities - s.450.1 Sealing/Reshuffling Cards; Dying - s.450.2 Boosting Intent - s.450.3 Dreamscape Phase/ Entity Turn - s.450.4

496.text:
Research on the Wormpeople, the soulless inhabitants of the world on the other side.

Based on our initial study, we estimate that wormpeople make up 65.7% of the total number of inhabitants, which corresponds to an 8.2% increase on last year.

From the outside, they look just like normal people, but they are actually nothing but empty biological shells.

It is worth noting that the scientists on the other side do not seem to be aware of the presence of this research facility in their world – perhaps they are blinded by analysis of divisions in categories which have no relevance, like complexion, belief, or wealth.

The Wormpeople have failed to develop any manifestation of empathy and self-awareness yet, but perfect mimicry allows them to function quasi-normally, especially as the numbers of their species grows.

They see other people only as obstacles, ssometimes even ignoring them completely.

To better blend in with the community, they use many effective (and probably instinctual) adaptation techniques taking on the traits of many negative human behaviours such as manifestations of hatred, irrational divisions between people, unnecessary competition, extreme materialism, etc.

Recommendations: We must stop this scourge from entering our world at all costs.

To illustrate the danger we're facing, even the most fearsome monsters of our world present a lesser threat.

They may be fierce, but at least they display signs of feelings and emotions.

Wormpeople have none whatsoever.

Signed: Professor Shelley and Dr.

Goodman.

Whimsical fate follows no mortal rules.

535.text:
A winding staircase leads dozens of metres down.

We are already far from the crumbling tenement houses on the surface, but still we feel their presence – their depressing decay reaches even here.

The remains of clothes and tools, old rags, photos, and toys flow down the pipes, like the debris of abandoned life.

There, deep underground, under the entire district, lives something that feeds on this decay, that feeds off forgetfulness, loneliness, despair – and that catches especially rare pearls in this waste.

It is a powerful being whose influence extends to the surface, that satiates its hunger by reaching out to buildings further and further away, dismantling the lives of their inhabitants.

We must face this being, discover the source of its power – and survive.

Finally, we reach the final step.

Black sludge floods the brick corridors and underground halls like the debris of forgotten life.

Old furniture and abandoned appliances float around, flowing through pipes towards who knows where.

Movements in the water cause rippling echoes in the dark, as if something just below the surface was alive and waiting for its next victim to come along.

And here we are.

The whole district is rotting and falling apart, with scattered debris, pulsing with maggots and crawling things, piled up everywhere.

Sidewalks are cracked, trees are warped and withered, a dank gray fog envelops the streets.

There used to be a hotel here – today, only part of the sign remains, hanging from the deserted building "...ORNIA".

The only light comes from the slaughterhouse – a sinister, red glow bathing the sky.

The stench of iron hangs in the air.

The door is so smeared with blood we hesitate before knocking, our knuckle rapping wetly.

As we wipe the blood off disgustedly, the door opens, and a hulking butcher stands before us, a huge rusty cleaver in his hand, dripping dark liquid onto the floor.

"Have you got something for me? I need more commodities.

I'm running low and people are still hungry." 545.text:
We find ourselves in a strange, gray city.

Desolate buildings covered with cobwebs surround us.

Twisted rails jut out of the thick layer of dust – strands of web and rust battle to claim their metallic flesh.

We try stomping loudly, to bring some life to this emptiness, but even the sound is dull and the dust settles more quickly than is natural.

We turn and realise we have left no footprints behind us.

We notice enormous spiders – the only movement anywhere – squatting at the centre of their webs far away, absorbed in whatever hideous task engrosses them.

We are fortunate not to be close enough to see their handiwork.

We don't feel well here – in fact, quite the opposite.

The omnipresent dullness saps our joy and drains our will to achieve anything...

Sometimes, when the depression comes, all that's left is to exist.

We meander aimlessly among the floating ash as if walking through dense mists – without purpose, without thought of escape to a brighter life.

It feels like the longest winter in history.

It's the Spiderweb World.

A sudden flood of recollection stops me mid-walk – for one moment, all the recovered memories overlap and I have the feeling that I understand who I really am and who I was before.

On one side of the bed sits a little boy in a yellow sweater holding a ball; on the other, a tired, old woman sits – she's sleeping soundly.

The clock on the wall reads 4:05pm.

There is a handful of white pills on the table next to a pot of buckthorn with dead flowers.

The strangest thing is that there are two suns in the sky outside the window, one small and yellow, the other large, fading, and red.

Where am I? Already...

Already here, back.

The images fade, and the feeling of strange cosiness – along with the glare from the suns – falls away.

But I can't pull myself together for a long time.

Starlight sashimi is a delicacy few have encountered before.

It is a harbinger of clouds, and soon a storm is pushing us onwards again.

from the burned windows of ruined cities – if anyone survived there.

It's strange, but sometimes we can talk without saying a word.

We would have said even more about where we came from, how we got here, and where we were going, if only we ourselves were in a position to know.

We really didn't get away with it.

At the last moment, right before the last shadow perished under the sun rays, our protege flees – his breath is shallow, his heart broken to pieces.

What will be his life's work now when everything in his eyes has lost purpose? In the end though, things are apparently not so bad – a few words and signatures later and he feels needed once again.

A great cause awaits him.

Ouch! Well...

I knew it was risky to handle something like this.

Eventually, we reach the end of the gang territory, and we move on towards a better place.

Or so we hope.

658.text:
We have been crossing these endless swamps for days.

Mosquitoes torment us constantly and the ground bubbles with every step, releasing fumes that carry the stench of rotting earth.

When the fog thins at last, we see many lights twinkling in the distance.

This is the Glass Sea where the water is replaced with glass, of course.

Giant waves of deadly sharp shards and mud moving with the tides.

We pause to admire their glittering beauty and majesty but the deafening roar of splintering waves makes us keenly aware of the danger.

A high tower stands in the middle of the sea, its top adorned with a moored balloon swaying in the wind.

The tower seems to be sinking slowly into the sea of glass.

How will we ever get to the top? Thousands of screeching voices carry to us from afar.

A dark cloud of crows surrounds the tower.

The stream of black birds scatters back and forth before before turning in our direction and beginning their dive ...

We thread our way between the sparkling blades as fast as we can, burning our last residues of strength and determination.

Each Dreamer Flips 1 Progress card or suffers 1 damage .

659.text:
Do you meet the specific conditions from the Train card (if there are any)? If yes, read on.

To travel is to wait – that's when time begins to make fun of us.

The steady clackety-clack of the rails seems to slow down, the images outside the window move more lazily, almost as if we are taking a stroll.

As usual, sleep comes to the rescue.

A dream within a dream...

Victory.

Retrieve all stolen Item cards (if there were any).

660.text:
It takes us a while, because we have never done anything like this before, but we finally manage tothrow a life raft overboard.

Yet, we fail to change our course.

When we look around, we cannot see the poor soul anymore.

Don't discard the current Turn card.

661.text:
Those pretty thick bushes are our "base".

Sparrows live here, but they aren't at home at the moment.

Nobody will find me here.

Place your Personal token in this space.

Whenever you suffer damage and you are in this space, you may discard your Personal token from this space to prevent 1 damage .

662.text:
Day never dawns here, night lasts forever.

The other characters slowly crawl away, scattering without saying a word.

We are still waiting, trying to understand where we are, and why.

From time to time, the building's door closes again and then opens, pouring out green water full of bodies.

We don't want to wait here any longer...

Remove 1 gem from the game or each Dreamer gains 1 Flaw .

Resolve - s.111

663.text:
We read the text, looking over our shoulders nervously.

At one point, we stop at a description of a sunny landscape.

However, at the same time, we can still hear the rain in the dark outside the window.

The image conjured up by the paragraphs blends with our surroundings, and soon we see the scene it describes, but overrun by the shadows of the night.

Heavy raindrops crush fields of grain, the path turns into a rushing torrent of mud.

There is also a thatched cottage.

We hope it's dry in there...

Reveal card G .

664.text:
"Don't mind me, I don't exist," the girl says, brushing her braids away.

We try speaking with her, but she ignores us.

– Okay, don't be afraid, we will leave you alone...

- s.413 – Nobody else heard you.

You may not have called to us out loud, but we can still hear you...

- s.803

"YES! I promise this won't hurt.

This won't hurt at all..." The last thing we see is a huge, gaping mouth...

Failure.

"Some friendly advice – keep this close to you.

"Thank you, thank you very much." The beggar immediately eats the money we've donated.

"I would like to drink something now.

Like they say, I'm like a bottomless pit – I have to eat and drink every single day – would you believe that? Well...

I wonder, where is all this milk and honey which they talk about? I've looked in every corner and I still haven't found anything.

But you probably have better eyes than mine." And that's it.

Home at last! Twelfth floor, the door on the left.

Wait...

The door is different...

It's extremely thin, like an insect, and very tall.

Oh, it's not the twelfth...

When we regain consciousness, we are lying on solid ground, but we still hear the sound of the sea.

Rocks are piled high, forming natural sculptures.

Somewhere in the sky, we see a gate – beyond, stars and unknown planets move slowly.

We would never reach there.

We look around – it looks like we are on a mysterious island...

The beast flexes contentedly, like a predator over downed prey that no longer has the strength to fight or flee.

685.text:
"If someone asks you...

If...

Probably not, but just in case – if you choose me, then you will not regret it.

The real gem is waiting in the garage." Peek at card J .

686.text:
We can get around on our hands and knees.

Long corridors go left, turn right, bend – it's a real maze.

A weird stench comes from Zone B3.

At one point, we see a strange room through the ventilation grille...

687.text:
"Strange...

I don't even know how to bite it." If no Dreamer has resolved this script yet, place the Team marker in the Prison Location – each Dreamer Reminds once, then move the Bowl to the next Checkpoint.

688.text:
Dry land! We finally spy the shore! We rest in a filthy tavern – but after the long and exhausting journey, a hard, crude chair is as comfortable as a soft bed, and a cup of water witha piece of bread makes a lavish banquet.

We see other people's faces – and we find that we pined for other people so much.

We rediscover that everything we have and everything surrounding us is so precious, so wonderful! The tavern bustles with patrons – their forks stab tasty delicacies, but their faces twist in disgust after each bite.

They smell their mugs, wrinkle their noses, and put their drinks aside.

The waiters and the bartender are barraged continuously with complaints: "What's this? I won't even touch it, it's a scandal! Awful, I want something else!" We look at the cup standing on our table – it's so alluring and beautiful.

We are sure that nobody notices what we see – it's ordinary wood, but to us it sparkles like pure silver.

Victory.

Each Dreamer gains 1 ether .

Each Dreamer cures 1 damage and Unseals 3 cards .

689.text:
We look hopefully at the light seeping from between the bars.

After a while, we begin to understand how we might get there.

It's still an achievement.

694.text:
*Through the clear windows, we see people sitting in satin armchairs – all of them hidden in deep shadows.

Only their hands, holding crystal chalices filled with red wine, are visible.

Sometimes, one of the figures stands up, but before we can see their face, they turn into mist, a pack of rats, or a cloud of bats.

"This is a vampire-only bar.

Are you one of us?" – a bouncer asks.* If you have an active Vampire Progress card - s.462 If not , you are not admitted into the bar.

695.text:
We cannot perceive the passage of time – we focus only on ourselves.

Months, years, decades...

It doesn't matter, as we are insignificant to the world.

It's not that easy to leave this place.

It won't let you escape! Reshuffle the 12 Turn cards and make a new Turn deck .

696.text:
The entire district is flooded.

Boats and even larger ships float between the tenement houses, carrying residents.

Fishing rods hang from almost every window.

There are deckchairs on the roof of a low building sticking out just above the water, like on a seaside beach.

Well, when I next see a boring old puddle, I don't think I'll call it a flood again.

You may find and remove the Flood card from the Fate deck (if it's already in the game) OR Settle any 1 Business from any spaces.

697.text:
Suddenly, lightning strikes the water near us, and we see a huge, clawed hand hiding in the clouds from the corner of our eyes.

Something shiny floats where the lightning struck – it must be a newborn star.

Spend 1 gem or suffer 1 damage .

If you have any Constellation cards , place 1 marker on any of them.

698.text:
Wednesday, 7am, time for school.

Breakfast and notebooks in the backpack, baseball cap on head – off we go.

The city is already awake, and the sun warms the streets.

Grandma Abby sits on her bench and feeds the pigeons, as usual.

A beautiful, white airship sails the clear sky.

699.text:
The age-old clock, the third great owner of this house, measures each smallest fragment of life, ticking an announcement of its passing.

If the Lamp and the Locker are both on B2 , resolve: You may discard 2 Turns and Seal 5 cards to gain card M (Eternal Riddle).

700.text:
The table is equipped with steel manacles – presumably in case the research subject has something against being examined.

There is also a microscope and a whole range of analytical devices.

If only there were something to examine...

You may Seal 1 card to gain 2 gem .

701.text:
The garage is incredibly vast.

Instead of lamps, light streams in through rows of colourful skylights.

Peering through one of them, we glimpsea fragment of the maze that we have not yet seen.

Reveal card D .

A beautiful blue car stands on a large rotating pedestal.

It's for sale...

If this is the Old Dream , you may discard 2 ether to gain card H (Blue car) .

702.text:
Hidden between some fragments of rubble there is an entrance to the dug-out tunnel.

I just have to squeeze through and...

I'm inside.

Reveal card C .

703.text:
We inhale the fresh aroma of the green fields and experience a sense of release we've not felt for a very long while.

We can finally be our true selves here – casting aside the face we portray to the world in our daily lives for the first time in ages.

You may return any one of your Masks to the Mask pool (and return its card back to the Secrets) to draw 3 cards from the Influence Market and gain l of them for free.

704.text:
We perform a rescue manoeuvre – it all goes like clockwork, each person playing their part, as if we'd been doing this all our lives.

The rescued man, dripping water onto the deck and getting his breath back, can hardly find the words to thank us.

He promises to help us out on the ship and, in return for saving his life, insists on giving us one of his treasures.

Gain 1 Key .

Discard the current Turn card .

705.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

706.text:
This is definitely bigger than even the largest swimming pool we could ever imagine.

A colossal amphitheatre surrounds the first, separate shallow section but behind the other submerged barriers, even vaster and deeper areas open up.

Swarms of people swim between ships and the water is teeming with fish, plants, and strange creatures of the deep.

The weirdest thing is that as soon as we are in the water it feels as though we become a part of this aquatic ecosystem and have belonged here forever.

Floating effortlessly, we take a tentative taste of the water and find that it's salty.

We soon discover that swimming is also just as easy and soon we're reaching unbelievable speeds, out limbs moving like human jet skis.

Just a few smooth kicks and paddles take us a mile away from where we were.

We start to explore the unusual seabed.

It turns out that bobbing along on the bottom of the beautiful briny sea is very relaxing indeed.

Each Dreamer Unseals 6 cards and cures 2 damage .

707.text:
It's true that the whirlpools of the far north are especially dangerous.

The ocean plays with us as if we were a golf ball, trying to score a point for putting us roughly into the hole.

Each Dreamer on this tile spends 1 gem or discards 1 placed Progress card .

708.text:
Pitchers full of water and bags of soil lie all around.

Common, everyday ingredients – worthless in their current state, until they are turned into valuable, glorious mud - with the help of some elbow grease.

The heart of the Mill radiates light and energy, but it beats unevenly.

It is sick, that's for sure.

Draw 2 influence cards .

709.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

710.text:
In the wet wall, between the crumbling tiles, a deep hole gapes.

There is something in there.

It's hard to reach, but maybe it's worth making the effort...

You may Restore 1 Item .

711.text:
Another risky leap into the dark – it gives me the creeps every time.

How much yellow did you spend? 1-2 – Resolve Cold Bath .

3 or more – Reveal tile X if it is not revealed, then Relocate to C4 , either to the space with the crate or to the one with the lifebuoy.

We ponder whether it's always the best plan to jump as far as possible.

After all, we could miss something valuable that had been closer to us.

712.text:
Ship's log 13 .

Another month has passed.

And another one.

And one more year.

And another...

Aeons have passed, too numerous to count.

The destination that has patiently awaited me at the end of my journey finally looms into view...

The coordinates are accurate – I can see the familiar arrangement of stars and the Sun.

But what appears on the screen and radar...

That cannot be true.

Each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

Gain 1 Hour .

713.text:
It's nine o'clock.

There is nothing here but a cold and empty darkness...

Suffer 1 damage and Seal 1 card .

There is no secret here.

715.text:
The Tormentor drifts away – and we are able to turn back to our lost planet.

The journey lasts forever, during which the little energy that remained in our bodies deserts us, and everything goes dark.

When we regain consciousness, we are lying on a strange platform, our saucer lying a little way from us.

This place looks like a farm...

or maybe a factory? However, when we look around more, a shocking truth comes to us – we are on a huge table – and we are a part of the feast that is currently underway.

Giants sit all about us, and their meaty hands reach over our heads for another dish.

If there's 0 marker on the Entity tile, this Dream ends - s.006 Otherwise, each Dreamer sets aside: a number of cards in their hand equal to the number of marker on the Entity tile, a number of cards from the top of their Influence deck equal to the number of marker on the Entity tile (if you don't have enough cards in your deck to do that, take the missing cards from the top of your Discard pile).

716.text:
The rays of the sun shine out of the photo and warm our cold skin.

You may Seal 3 cards to cure 1 damage .

A terifying portrait of an ancestor hangs next to it.

Either the painter was prodigiously inept, or the man was a monster in human skin – the picture is so ancient that nobody knows the truth anymore.

Suddenly, a movement! The creature from the portrait lunges out at us, his clawed hands draw us to him in a morbid embrace.

Spend 1 gem or Seal 1 card .

717.text:
We are swallowed whole in one bite by the machine, now bumping against the insides of its steel armor in pitch blackness.

It carries us off somewhere, each juddering step causing us bruises and jolts of pain as we are shaken about.

Finally, the moving container opens, disgorging us like sacks of potatoes.

We roll down a wide pipe until we finally land in a dark underground hall, barely illuminated by a single red light.

We are not alone here.

Each Dreamer discards 1 ether or gains 1 Flaw .

Relocate the Team to the Prison Location on the Dreamworld Map.

718.text:
"What a curious idea – to throw one's face into the water! The Pearl Hunter did that once and has been searching for its lost visage ever since.

When you lose your face, you cannot bear to live near others for long.

Though maybe that's actually just a made-up excuse, so the creature can hide away in this darkness forever...

All right, give me that, let's have a go!" The line is cast.

You don't have to wait too long, you'll be reeling something in very soon.

Gain 1 random card from the Influence Market for free .

Then, resolve - s.076

There is no secret here.

There is no secret here.

722.text:
This place used to be beautiful.

Bustling with life, people, friends, and lovers.

If it was once, couldn't it be so again? Where are our friends? Have they abandoned us? Where is our home? Will thinking about the past and the future bring us solace or despair? If there are 2 Webs or more on the Empty Home tile – Somber thoughts drown us in their endless sea.

– Nothing else happens, though.

If there are fewer than 2 Webs on the Empty Home tile, gain card B .

723.text:
We arrive at the last moment, as the airship is already beginning departing procedures.

We have a long journey ahead of us, but at least this way we can actually reach our destination.

Unfortunately they don't allow freeloaders on board, so we negotiate to work for our fare, taking orders like the rest of the crew.

Labour has never been a problem for us though.

Maybe we can catch something valuable in the clouds? Take the top Cloud card and place it in the Dreamscape according to the Cloud cards rules on the Dream Gate tile.

724.text:
What do we need a wheel for? Madness and fear must have taken hold in our minds.

Spawn 1 Tentacle (use Creature Shapeshifter) on this tile and roll for its Movement.

You may add card I to the Flaw deck to draw 4 influence cards.

725.text:
A puny figure finally emerges from the treacle-like ooze of the swamp.

It rubs its face, struggling until two clear circles finally appear in the coating of mud - eyes, probably.

A third gap in the mud opens up wetly to release a short sentence: "Thanks for saving my life..." So it's not a monster, after all! This is an interesting and powerful feeling – to actually save someone's life.

Roll the Luck die : luck-1 = Gain all available gem .

luck-2 = Unseal 8 cards .

luck-3 = Gain 1 ether .

726.text:
We try focusing all our anger to make good use of it – it makes us feel alive.

But can we ever stop? Or will we lose ourselves in hatred and thrash mindlessly around forever – punishing both the world and ourselves with pain.

If you have the Calmness card, discard it and discard all Web tokens from the Hermitage and Life Ruins tiles.

Otherwise, every Dreamer on the Hermitage tile suffers 1 damage .

727.text:
We hear a quiet prayer – someone calls to us needing our help.

We close our eyes and think we understand what they want...

When we open our eyes again, we are somewhere else.

Our clothes are now modest, we blend in well with the bleak surroundings.

It's night, no sound taints the silence of this place.

Patrolling drones hover silently above the ground.

This district is surrounded by a high wall topped with barbed wire.

The city seems rather normal – the only thing missing is freedom.

A young man stands next to us furtively glancing around from the shadows.

We know he's a man, but he looks like a stuffed sock – just like all the residents of this place.

He doesn't see us – his eyes are fixed on a balcony, imagining his lover inside the apartment, behind the drawn curtains.

But something else does notice us too.

A beast, snarling with boundless hatred, has chosen the young man, our protege, as its prey and will seek to end his life this night.

We have to help the youngster avoid the trap set by this cruel life and survive this dangerous night to meet with the one he pines for.

Let's do it!

728.text:
We accomplish the impossible! The monster falls into the swamp and sinks slowly beneath the surface.

For long trepidatious moments we can't take our eyes away the spot...

but there is no further movement.

Breathing a sigh of relief, we return to the chest and enjoy our spoils.

Each Dreamer gains 3 ether .

Gain 2 Keys .

Gain 1 new random Item from the Item Market .

Then, resolve - s.637

729.text:
The huge wave we're now surfing feels as tranquil as sitting in a rocking chair.

We can even rest for a while without losing speed! Each Dreamer on this tile may Flip 1 Progress card to Unseal 5 cards .

Then, Relocate 1 Dreamer from this tile to any other space on the other side of the Wall of this tile.

730.text:
This moment could last forever.

When we stop moving forward, something draws nearer to us...

It's coming closer and closer.

We do not feel fear because what approaches is familiar and dear to us.

Try to move, break out of this stupor – discard 1 Turn and resolve - s.044 OR Just wait...

– discard 3 Turns and resolve - s.366

731.text:
( Note : If you came to this script because it seemed to you that you could combine different numbers in one of the Dreams - you made a mistake otherwise continue reading.) Dark water crashes against the walls, droplets sharp like broken glass.

The black waves resemble the outstretched wings of a huge bird flapping furiously, unsuccessfully trying to take off from the ground.

The waves grab and buffet us, preventing us from getting away.

If card C is not revealed – reveal it .

Do not discard this tile.

All Dreamers on this tile may Relocate to any start space.

If card C is already revealed – nothing can save you, and you fail.

Resolve - s.176

732.text:
"It's quite tasty.

You may pass." Return the Mushroom card to the Secrets of this Dream.

Each Dreamer Reminds twice.

Move the Bowl to the next Checkpoint.

733.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

734.text:
Several hundred billion stars in our galaxy, several hundred billion known galaxies – are they all dead, and are we just some miraculous exception, a sad joke on a completely empty scene filled to the brim with endless nowhere? For many years, the laboratory has been screening different wavelengths and intensities of cosmic noise.

We came across a strange clue last year.

With further research, and thanks to this device, today we received a signal...

A clear signal.

Does this mean that we are not the only manifestation of life in this endless space? Maybe today we will prove that we are not alone.

Place a block token on this action and gain 1 gem .

735.text:
Ship's log 12 .

I set the course again.

I will use the rest of the fuel for the last turning manoeuvre.

Theengines, left unpowered for years, come alive again to correct this steady course toward nothingness.

Finally, a sound reaches my ears, and I see the light that I had long forgotten.

The engines splutter to life.

The unchanging palette of inaccessible stars finally shifts, the ship turns back.

The remaining fuel gives one last boost.

I don't know if I'll ever get home, but it's better to die on a road that has a purpose at last.

That gives me hope.

Home has become my religion, which gives me strength.

I move towards it...

The return is an immeasurably long period of lost consciousness, hallucinations, strange dreams, physical pain, and madness.

I can dream of whole worlds, but they are different from the ones I remember.

A human can't be alone for so long away from their home.

The days stretch into months and months into aeons.

How can a person survive for aeons? The mind and body have their limits.

But what awaits at the end is the faint light of hope in the tunnel of deadly darkness.

What awaits, in any form, is home.

Even if empty and extinct, it is still a better grave than the godless emptiness of space.

Each Dreamer gains 1 ether .

Cross out the number on the "Reading the Ship's log" and write a new one: "712" .

736.text:
We see the Mill tower in front of us nearby.

Unfortunately, brambly thickets block the road.

We have to find a way around or break through them somehow.

Reveal tile Y .

One of the workers passes nearby, hunched over and barely shuffling.

When he crosses a small bridge, slime-covered musicians emerge from the swamp and play a slow march to the rhythm of his steps.

This is a rather bleak show.

As the music slowly accelerates, the worker adjusts his gait to keep in time.

Did it work then?

737.text:
A second great ocean, calm and quiet, without any visible storms or waves, stretches into infinity in all directions – a boundless outer space, full of unreachable stars.

It is difficult to say how long we have been drifting because nothing here counts down days and nights.

We are in a strange flying saucer.

How did this happen? We bought it at the market, we wanted to see how high it could lift us – and, at some point, we slipped away from the gravitational pull of the planet – just bad luck.

We pass a lazy comet – the first object in a very long time – then for a long time, nothing.

And finally, after countless days, something (or someone?) approaches us, drifting in space like we do.

It's something we can push away from and finally turn back...

Do your best – it may be your last chance to battle for your life.

You only have 1 Turn ...

Note: What are the Bowl and Checkpoints described in the Special Rules on the Dream Gate tile? Forget about them for now.

738.text:
Now, as the wind presses mast against forestay, you can calmly repair the backstay.

Discard the current Turn card .

739.text:
Souvenirs, mementos, countless trinkets.

Pleasant and unpleasant, as if it was a duty to hold onto both.

Why do people keep such sad things at all? Do they like suffering? I must admit that sadness is sometimes tasty.

Then, something begins to crawl out of a nearby mirror.

It has not taken form yet, but we already see hands reaching for our neck.

We have to break the glass before the monster gets out! If this is a light space – add 1 Morphing .

If this is a night space – add 3 Morphings .

Finally, you may Move the Locker 2 spaces or Relocate the Lamp to any tile .

740.text:
As the last of the ghosts dissipates, we can finally take a deep breath.

They will be at peace for a while – this fight must have cost them a lot.

This Slumber ends.

Return this Slumber tile to the Secrets.

Add tile II-38 A (Fearspecters) to the Slumber deck.

741.text:
How many floors do you think the tallest building of the dream world has? This one here has at least a thousand – it's one of the highest.

We think the view from the roof of this skyscraper would be amazing – but the problem is that the lifts are not working today.

The door of one of the postboxes is open, and inside we see a golden envelope labeled: "Money Back." Choose 1: We could inform the recipient.

Let's check...

Oh, three hundred and third floor, it would be a LONG climb – you may Seal 3 cards or suffer 1 damage to resolve - s.303 It's not our problem if someone has been careless.

Should we take it? – gain 4 gem .

It's none of our business – let's just get out of here.

742.text:
"The mysterious island lies just next to dry land.

But it's still hard to get there.

This knowledge makes many adventurers' heads spin – an unknown land hidden under their noses." Gain 1 gem .

743.text:
This thing is right next to us, just a little longer and...

As if hypnotized, we are still waiting, and time seems to freeze.

Choose 1: Stand up and move on – discard 1 Turn and resolve - s.044 Just wait – discard 3 Turns and resolve - s.366

744.text:
Ok, let's pretend nothing happened.

Discard the current Turn card .

745.text:
It's difficult to focus on anything here because on top of a movie is playing in the background (nothing new, just some old rerun), there is also a theatrical performance on the stage in front of it.

At the same time, loud music flows out of speakers drowning out the all the actors' voices.

Each patron sits at a table and bleak, cheerless waiters set dishes and cutlery endlessly – even without the music, the clang of cutlery would drown out the movie.

If that wasn't enough to distract you, a games console is mounted at each table.

It's just a little hard to focus on anything.

You may discard 1 Turn to cure 3 damage .

746.text:
We see a group of strange silhouettes when we leave the port.

They are almost as strange as we are – a large man with a mechanical arm, a short woman hovering over the ground, and something with a hat on their head, crawling on all fours.

They look around cautiously, a perfect echo of our behavior.

Maybe we will meet them again? Victory.

747.text:
Knowledge of the battlefield is now the most important thing.

The dust conceals a maze of streets and ruined buildings.

Sometimes, when we reallystrain our eyes, we can even see small, green manifestations of life - other than the ubiquitous pale birds, eating leftovers hidden among the dust.

Reveal tile V (Scavenger) unless it's already revealed.

Add 1 Turn.

748.text:
Is it not over yet? We are barely able to stay on our feet, but the others we face have also gone through many hardships this night.

What's next? Some ghost? Maybe a robot? Bring it on! Each Dreamer cures 1 damage or Unseals 2 cards .

Resolve the top card from the Arena Fate deck (remember to add 1 Dreamscape Slumber Map tile!).

749.text:
At night, faceless shadows are drawn here from various parts of the city.

Whispers intermingle, exchanging knowledge about the daily events occurring throughout the city.

Under cover of darkness, detectives appear here to find answers to their pressing questions.

Information is cheap, but nobody expects too much from life here.

Settle all Businesses from any 1 chosen tile.

Then, if there are no Dreamers or Denizens on that tile, you may replace it with the other corresponding tile that was not drawn during the Dream Setup.

750.text:
Time is malicious by nature.

When we hurry, it sprints by; when we wait, it crawls.

When we suffer pain, it seems to turn into eternity; when we are happy, it dissolves through our fingers like grains of sand.

The clock and calendar are its obedient soldiers, ready to take the last scintilla of joy from us.

A large clock hangs on the wall of the station.

Half the people here are rushing with suitcases to catch their train, and the other half are waiting drone-like until their train arrives.

Very few smiles, lots of irritation and pent-up anger.

What are we doing here? We are hustling and, at the same time, waiting for a train.

Heavy baggage, seemingly appearing out of nowhere - is it a product of our subconscious?! - hinders our movements.

Wait, what time is it? Surely, it's time to wake up, but we can't.

We must board any train, if not to just to escape this station of operational tedium.

"This reminds us of when our world was ending...", Wait, what's this thought? When our world was ending?!...

What a crazy thought! The chaos of the station has crept into our heads.

It's hard to think properly here.

Each Dreamer must Seal 3 cards or discard their Mask .

751.text:
One risky step too many...

The building was swaying disturbingly from the very moment we set foot in it and for a while we almost stopped paying attention to it.

Yet this time it tilted more and...

slowly at first, then faster and faster! We begin to slide across the rotten floor narrowing avoiding old furniture gliding towards us.

The city horizon lurches at an unnatural angle outside the window.

And then, it's all over.

The walls crack violently thenthere is only chaos, darkness and nothing more...

Failure.

Return all cards and tiles of this Dream (except for those already gained by Dreamers or added to the game decks) to the Secrets.

752.text:
The crate is very unstable – we almost fall into the water before jumping.

How much yellow did you spend? 1-4 – Resolve Cold Bath .

5 or more – Resolve - s.941 We ponder whether it's always the best plan to jump as far as possible.

After all, we could miss something valuable that had been closer to us.

753.text:
Well, what else could we buy here? We browse the colourful promises full of power.

The masked man pressures us and ridicules us, trying to stop us from backing out of the deal.

"Are you scared? I think you're a wimp.

This isn't for you.

You'd better retreat to your hole in the ground." It's a peculiar type of hard sell – we feel we should buy something to prove something to the seller.

Though we could also back off, right? Gain 2 Flaws and block this Map Action.

Then, you may suffer 1 damage to gain 1 Story token .

OR Return card G (Chemicals) to the Secrets of this Dream.

754.text:
In this huge, underground maze, we don't meet any people, only strange, often grotesque creatures, filthy, frustrated, boiling with anger.

It's curious that in our world, we treated such creatures with contempt.

Here, it's the other way around – we are the outcasts, we stick out, not fitting in this place.

Things that are normal to us are strange and unnatural here.

We proceed with caution, unsuccessfully trying to blend into these odd surroundings.

755.text:
The laboratory is destroyed.

All unnatural movement stops.

The terrible substitute for life which had reanimated them leaves the bodies of these unfortunate people.

We sit among the ruins.

Few pieces of equipment still work, smoke rises up to the ceiling.

Everything is spotted with water.

Printouts of projects and complicated analyses lie on the floor.

"Whole planet is dead on the other side," "Virus is spreading," "Shared reality cannot exist," and more hopeless headlines.

All leads and maps guided us here, to this laboratory.

For what purpose? There is a silver device on the floor, now detached from one of the machines.

We pick it up.

Victory.

757.text:
The Moon is barely visible through thick layers of clouds.

The rain angrily beats down on the cobblestones and mud streams rapidly through the narrow streets.

There is no one outside except us.

Patches of warm comforting light radiating from houses further emphasise the cold and darkness around us.

An antique car rolls down the street.

Our imagination conjures up images of gangsters with tommy guns leaping from their vehicles and opening fire - nothing like that happens of course.

Everything here looks like a crime movie from the forties though.

We feel an eerie, sinister darkness just behind us.

This ghoulish thing wants to destroy or enslave us, lurking in the darkness and ready to attack.

There are so many lanterns and lights from these houses – how will we find our silver key here? One of the doors catches our attention – on it is a plate carved with the name "Shelley." Maybe we should start there? Remember that in this Dream, in contrast to the rulebook, night in the form of Darkness Tentacles nullifies the light on their spaces (and any space in range 1).

758.text:
The sad worker mutters to himself: "I've always made mud with pride.

But lately, I have my doubts.

It's probably just fatigue and my health problems.

You know, it's hard to bear this pace until the very end.

But I can do it.

I'm going back to work...

The mud won't make itself! "Oh, hi! Can I help you with something?" You may discard 1 gem to Restore 1 Item .

759.text:
Nothing drives progress like conflicts and clashes.

At least the Endless City authorities believe that.

Therefore, from time to time, bloody competitions are organized in special arenas.

Everything is broadcast live throughout the city - the most expensive ads are featured.

Everyone can take part in the struggle to prove their true worth, both to themselves and to others.

Oh, there is also an address where you can sign up.

Well...

Gain tile II-40 O ("Welcome to the Arena" special Dream gate tile) .

760.text:
We wind up the old deformed clock, trying to coax some additional minutes or maybe hours out of its aged springs and cogs.

Choose one: Add 1 Turn and place all Dreamers in start spaces.

Add 1 Turn and each Dreamer suffers 1 damage .

Each Dreamer spends 1 ether .

Then add 2 Turns .

761.text:
This ancient machine seems functional – but how do we turn on this gigantic contraption? And what does it do? Slender, emaciated figures move around, slow and absent, like zombies.

They approach the glass, embrace it, trying to lick up remnants of the colourful substances.

Reveal card B .

762.text:
"It used to be better.

In the old days, I used to cast a line and immediately pull out whatever I could dream of.

Everything was so big and so easy, I could catch literally anything.

Today, I wait for countless hours, and nothing bites.

Sometimes I hook something, but usually it's just worthless rubbish.

I don't know if the world has become too miserable or whether I am too old.

Or maybe I just don't have the right lure? Maybe you have something more suitable? Give me that, and we'll try to catch something for you!" You may choose one: Discard 1 ether - resolve - s.617 Discard 1 gem - resolve - s.105 Discard your Mask - resolve - s.718

763.text:
We found the passage! The gate to the magnificent city is open again.

As we pass the golden towers and alabaster walls, the fairy-tale inhabitants look at us curiously, as if they haven't seen any newcomers for centuries.

Our great deeds are appreciated and soon we are met by the royal guard who leads us before the king of this boundless but non-existent land.

Our actions are very important for all these non-existent people (and not only people).

Those who don't exist will never forget us.

It is a pity that all this simply does not exist.

It's beautiful here nonetheless.

Dreamers may also swap their Masks with each other.

765.text:
In this part of the city, cobwebs are even more numerous.

They resemble tussled hair, bejewelled with many raindrops.

We accidentally touch one of them and discover that the water is salty and leaves trails which almost burn our skin! We are nervous but the atmosphere of this place could kill any butterfly that would like to inhabit our stomachs – not to mention that they would probably be eaten by spiders first! Thinking about it makes our eyes water.

766.text:
Dripping rain, the sounds and lights of the distant Endless City.

The cobblestones are slick with rainwater, brick buildings look dilapidated and abandoned...

The drizzle thins out the surrounding mist.

We are in the Foggy Docks, with its many warehouses, ships, and narrow alleys.

On a rainy night, a single lantern lights up the gloom, calling to us...

Magnifying glasses in hand and capes to protect us from the rain, we start our investigation.

Every detail seems to be significant and tells a story.

What are we investigating exactly? We're not sure but we feel the game is afoot! In addition to that investigation, we also have our own business to attend to here.

Before we arrived in this world, we had previously sent a parcel, addressed to ourselves.

It must have passed right here through the port.

If everything went according to plan, the parcel should still be waiting for us.

Probably in the warehouse.

If you're reading this, you have probably placed cards A and B .

And you probably don't understand what all this is about.

You can only look at the backs of these cards.

You cannot look at their fronts yet .

Before you can flip these cards and resolve their fronts, you must first complete the tasks on their backs .

767.text:
Did I mention that I don't like looking in mirrors? You never know if you will see something terrifying.

Well...

Damn.

That's what I'm talking about.

The reflection in the mirror is not me, I hope – I'm not a cockroach after all! Reveal card F .

768.text:
...except for one small spark.

This single spark of light is enough to give us the momentum to try again.

We crawl through the void, then endlessly through the dense darkness, until we finally see the world again – immersed in deep shadows, yes, but real nonetheless.

We are back.

Reshuffle the 12 Turn cards and make a new Turn deck .

769.text:
Our chain fits the ancient ones almost perfectly – we just need a little more time to connect them all! Depending on which tile you placed the Influence card with the Chain on, resolve accordingly: A2 tile – Distribute player damage between Dreamers or the Chain breaks (if it breaks, return that Influence card to the Influence Market).

770.text:
"No! Let us go, I don't want to see this.

Your despair, pain, and sadness – it's all yours, not ours, I don't want it from you! Let us out! Help!" Each Dreamer gains 2 Flaws.

771.text: Which Deliverance Card did you use? Rage - s.1057 Intimidation - s.1195 Deception - s.1077 Understand - s.1218 Open yourself - s.1130

772.text:
The room ends here.

A torso emerges from the darkness, trying to embrace us with its gnarled arms.

- If this is a night space, place 1 threat in this space (max.

1 threat per space).

773.text:
BANG! A shot rings out...

Roll the Luck die : luck-x - Ouch! Your Dreamer is dead.

luck-blank - Suffer 3 damage .

luck-1 - Suffer 2 damage .

luck-2 - Suffer 1 damage .

774.text:
Scaffolding extends dozens of yards high.

When we look at the sky, we suddenly notice that several stars are moving and appear to be expanding.

People around us also stare at the sky – something is happening.

The show in the firmament becomes more spectacular and disturbing.

When we realize that this is not an illusion, we are paralyzed by a sudden wave of disbelief and deep sadness.

So, is this the end of the world? Is this Judgment Day? Will there be no tomorrow? Silver crafts land one after another in the city, and probably in all cities around the world.

Does the world we know end now? When the first craft touches down, we see creatures crawl out of it – they resemble ants from this distance.

When we see the rays shaking skyscrapers and people searching hopelessly for shelter, we know we are witnessing the beginning of the end.

Choose one: Stay right here and wait for the end - s.836 Hide in the renovated building - s.096 Run to the outskirts of the city and the allotments - s.502

775.text:
Not so long ago, life used to flourish here – under the dust which blankets everything, we can see outlines of streets, once-prosperous shops, and residential houses interspersed with tree stumps and dead tufts of grass.

The coloured signs are broken and covered with a gray layer.

Everything was buried through the passage of time.

We notice traces of giant teeth on the buildings – something sinister has devoured this world.

Abandoned shopping trolleys form a massive pile – there are thousands of them, useless because nothing else can be bought anymore.

There's nothing left to devour here.

While wandering among the ruins, we see a great sleeping beast in the distance – it looks like a beautiful woman for a moment, but the illusion fades away, revealing a monstrous, eternally hungry creature.

Ghostly shadows move slowly around her, shackled to the dead shopping trolleys.

Note: If any Dreamer dies in this Dream, return all Influence cards placed on the Dreamscape to the Influence Market .

776.text:
The heavy door of the Warehouse is open.

Infinite shelves, each endlessly high and wide, contain all sorts of crates, chests, packages, barrels, sacks, and other containers in a variety of shapes and sizes.

You can only see a small fraction of it all – the rest is hidden in the darkness.

Check your Dream Gate Tile to see whether you entered the Gateway to the New Dream or the Old Dream .

777.text:
Ship's log 15 .

The sun sets slowly, a light, cool wind rises.

Clouds rush through the sky, small raindrops spatter the path.

The grass waves, the shadows begin to dance across the fields, trees rustle, the birds' singing slowly stops.

It's time to go home...

I need to sweep away the dust, air the place to get rid of the smell of long absence, and brew tea in my forlorn mug.

I'm going to sleep in my long-forgotten bed.

I want to snuggle myself into a blanket full of warmth and good memories.

It's good to be home again...

Each Dreamer gains 2 ether .

This is the last entry in the ship's log.

Remove the "Reading the Ship's log" from the game.

778.text:
A hidden room! It is pleasantly bright, and warm, quiet music flows from within.

We immediately start to feel safer than in the cold and dark halls of the library.

You may add card D to your Discard pile if it's still available, to add 3 Turns and gain 4 gem .

779.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

780.text:
There are so many roads to enlightenment...

Good movies, wise books, conversations, contemplation...

Maybe glowing fungi are another of them? What could possibly go wrong? Anyway, they don't taste so bad...

Gain 1 Flaw card .

Unseal 10 cards .

781.text:
We remember all those people who helped us in the past, passers-by who were nice or simply smiled at us.

Visions of their kind faces should rouse a wave of calmness to ease our hearts.

If there are more than 2 Webs on the Hermitage tile - Just thinking about anyone makes us angry.

- Choose 2 red intent cards in your Discard pile and add them to your hand.
