782.text:
We grab the board leaning against the wall but a stabbing pain makes us withdraw our hands.

We notice a small splinter embedded in our finger.

It immediately grows larger, causing our finger to bleed profusely.

What the hell is this? You suffer 1 damage .

You may cure it now if you Seal 6 cards .

783.text:
"You promised me so much, and now you're gone..." Enough! Finally...

The closet is empty.

A dirty smudge reaches a dark corner, where everything is piled up.

Something still twitches under the pile of clothes.

But, eventually, it stops moving.

Add card I (Come Here) to the Fate deck (if it's still in the Secrets of this Dream).

Place a block token on the 'Check the wardrobe' action on B2 .

Place a Wound token (from the damage pool) in your space.

Spawn 1 Cockroach on each spawn space.

784.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

785.text:
"I don't like it.

Take it back!" Nothing happens – take back this element.

786.text:
So that's what all this is about.

It's a revolver! When the protege hid it here, he had a look of determination and madness on his face.

We have to stop him! You may discard this card – then Relocate all Dreamers/Protege to start spaces.

787.text:
The Mill stands at the crossroads.

Crossroads often symbolize an important decision that is unavoidable so what choices awaits us here? The daylight is running out, and our legs are slowly getting sluggier and sluggier as we trudge through the mire.

We hear grotesque music floating across the water that suits the ubiquitous swamp very well.

A leaflet printed on a large leaf floats on the surface of a stinking swamp.

It's the only colourful thing in sight.

"This is the place where the potential for career and personal development awaits all ambitious people in a nice, swampy atmosphere.

It's the Swamp Mill! This is where soil is mixed with water, creating all the mud in the world.

It's tough, responsible work.

The grinding of thebig wheel, the lapping of water, the swampy vapours – maybe it'll be your next new home! The only obstacle to your success is you.

Don't be afraid of your dreams! Turn them into action!"

788.text:
Domain: Medicine.

Project objective: To use compressed imagination and deleted memories to heal human husks.

Problems: zombie syndrome, and void sprouting in the heart.

Research was conducted on twelve volunteers and one convict.

The results...

Add card I (Clinic) to the Fate deck .

789.text:
As the dust from the crumbling buildings irritates our eyes, we realize that this world is damaged beyond repair.

We can't do anything to fix it, and we can't run away from our negative thoughts.

But nothing prevents us from building something new.

Can we do it? Can we expect this new world to be a good thing? Do we have enough faith, enough positivity to bring it to life?

790.text:
"Normally I do not eat such things, you'd be barking up the wrong tree.

But...

Today I have a desire for something completely new – so give it to me!" Remove this envelope from the game.

Now you have to work out a new way of storing its contents.

Remind twice and move the Bowl to the next Checkpoint.

791.text: *"Ahbwalala! And what do you think?" Reveal card B .

792.text:
We watch two oceans collide.

The one beneath is magical, impenetrable, turbulent, and full of life – it flagellates itself with raging waves, splashing around green tears and whipped foam.

The one above is calm – adorned with stars, flawless, and boundless.

Their battle happens on the horizon – the only neutral ground – trying to push it upwards or downwards as they seek to expand their territory.

We stand at the shore – the last bastion of the third power in this conflict, but it seems too weak in comparison to compete with the oceans.

Both water and sky call to us like two great mysteries waiting for someone to explore them.

We go back to the tavern to warm ourselves with a hot drink and find shelter from the cold, salty rain.

We will set off soon, we wait only for a storm to strike.

On the calm sea we would never find the secret path we're looking for.

May the stars that lead us not disappoint.

793.text:
Something lies on the tall pile of old furniture.

What's that? If the Locker is in this space, you may add 3 Morphings and Spawn 1 Puppet to add card I (What's that?) to the Fate deck .

Finally, you may Move the Locker 2 spaces or Relocate the Lamp to any tile .

794.text:
It works, but the end of the line whips me in the face.

Suffer 1 damage .

Discard the current Turn card .

795.text:
We wipe the slime off the big red button.

We push on it with all our might, and finally, it gives up.

Somewhere, far away in the dark, we can hear the bubbling of water and the crunching of a mechanism.

Something emerges – among the faint reflections on the black surface, we can see several dark shapes.

Reveal card A and card B .

796.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

797.text:
Here you can understand what this whole city is about.

You don't have to win here, nothing will happen if you lose – it's about life, doing business, making profits, getting what you want.

You know what I mean? And if you want something more – look to the city limits, where the vibrant bustle dies away, and where concrete gives way to wild greenery.

Perhaps this is the gateway we are seeking? You may spend 1 gem to Settle any 1 Business from any space.

You may place 2 Businesses in any spaces with any Turn Suit symbol (max.

1 Business per space) to gain card G (I breathe the city) .

798.text:
The guard holds us by the collar like rude students, our feet barely touching the ground as we follow them into the unknown.

With every step, we become smaller, and our captor grows stronger...

"Well, you got what you deserved." The stem voice does not leave us much hope.

This Slumber ends.

Each Dreamer discards all their red-progress cards OR each Dreamer suffers 1 damage .

Relocate the Team to the Prison Location on the Dreamworld Map.

Return this Slumber tile to the Secrets.

Add tile II-38 S (Furious Warden) to the Slumber deck.

799.text:
We are tired...

Forcing ourselves to do ANYTHING feels impossible.

We've been like this for too long, and we grow weary of it.

We have to rest, but we can't – when we close our eyes, we can only think of our failures, and that we could have done things better in the past.

The future isn't welcoming either – we have so many things to do tomorrow.

800.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

801.text:
The feeling of danger intensifies so much that we instinctively look for something that could serve as a weapon.

And then we remember the oldest ancestor of all weapons - a crude rock.

We quickly dig out a loose piece of cobblestone.

We feel as if this stone was waiting just for us.

Armed with this improvised projectile, we begin to consider our options.

After all, nothing happens here by accident.

Choose one: Throw the stone at the creeping darkness - s.464 Throw the stone at the window above the closed door - s.053

802.text:
We try to get through the thorny wall of plant life as it looks like there's something behind it.

And to our horror, we discover that a creature has made its lair here...

Reveal card G and Spawn 1 Grunting Creature in this space (use Creature Shapeshifter).

803.text:
"I am not here but somewhere else entirely.

You have simply stumbled upon my shadow, which cries because it wandered off and got lost after becoming separated from me.

It's scared and tries to hide from what lurks in the dark.

Can you hear the other shadows too? The unbearable dark choir of the lost, wailing in fear and screaming for help.

The noise can become deafening if you focus on it too much.

"I hope I haven't gone on too long...

But thank you." The shadow begins to dissolve into the air, although now we realise that we can actually hear distant screams and crying.

There are too many of them to make out what any are saying, and we try to ignore them as best we can.

Eventually, the shadow disappears – taking another small part of this world with it.

Choose 1: Remove 1 chosen Morphing from the game .

Remove 1 chosen Slumber tile from the game .

Then, remove this Fate card from the game .

804.text:
It's a bad time, I shouldn't be here.

Suffer 1 damage and Seal 1 card .

805.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

806.text:
"So little energy for something that was once a living creature.

Such a pity." Return the Meat card to the Item Market.

Each Dreamer Reminds twice.

Move the Bowl to the next Checkpoint.

807.text:
We fall onto a crate floating on the surface as we splash, kick and paddle ungainly, trying to stay afloat.

After a while, we manage to find our balance.

Reveal card C , if it is not revealed yet.

Relocate to any crate on C4 .

808.text:
An old woman picks up porcelain figurines from the furniture, cleaning them brusquely and placing them back methodically.

She stops to look at photographs from time to time, lost in memories.

"Since I'm alone, I will dust all our souvenirs till they're spick and span so that when they come back, we can admire them together..." You may Seal 1 card to Restore 1 Item .

809.text:
No...

Not the shattered glass again! - If this is a night space, spend 2 red or suffer 1 damage .

A huge closet slumbers in a pile of rubbish.

We hear a gentle rhythmic hiss coming from its drawers.

Well, we probably shouldn't open it...

Or maybe there's something useful inside? If you decide to open it - s.276

810.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

811.text:
The evening reading turns out to be extremely interesting and a real page-turner.

One might even say addictive.

As we devour the story, the world it portrays seems more and more real, and the room we are in less and less so, until we can smell and hear the locations it describes.

Finally the room and the book vanish altogether, letters and words disappearing, and...

we find ourselves standing in a dark hall.

It's a labyrinth of huge rooms, a jumble of floors interconnected with stairs and instead of walls – endless shelves filled with books.

This truly is a great library.

These forgotten books hold the all the stories of the lives of people, both those long gone and those still living.

Some of theirsparks were extinguished long ago without leaving any trace in the world – but they still made their mark here.

By reading these books, you could live a million lives.

Lives unlike anything we've ever known or experienced.

There is also your book somewhere, though that one is still being written.

Is there anyone guarding this place? We'd better tread carefully.

812.text:
It's hard to tell how much time has passed since we started looking for the exit, but finally, we emerge from this bloody subterranean nightmare.

If there's threat in range 1 , suffer 1 damage .

Relocate to any start space.

You may reveal any 1 unrevealed Map tile in the same row or column and place your Dreamer in the start space of that tile.

813.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

814.text:
Someone has carved a plan of the entire building on the brick wall.

"You are here" is marked with an X.

Ah, now we understand! It's hard to figure out how all these passages and corridors connect without a map.

If all Dreamers are on C3 , you may discard any Floors (back to the Floors deck).

Discard all Rats from each discarded Floor card.

If there is a Fearspecter on a discarded Floor card, Relocate it to any spawn space.

815.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

816.text:
One more button? We hit it with all our might – and the old mechanism grinds to life immediately.

The whole island shakes and a stone bridge emerges from the water.

Reveal card F .

817.text:
We pass by a family that is already heading towards the exit.

The husband looks towards us with a proud look that mockingly says, "I've seen everything here first before you." He remarks to his wife (but loud enough so that we can hear), "I liked the car in the underground garage the best.

Gorgeous! First class..." Gain 1 gem .

818.text:
The people seem afraid.

"Please don't ughruu tnod kcatta xolp! Setam kaeps, I swear!" If we press them a little more, we will definitely get what we are looking for - some hint about how to get to the Mill.

You may spend an additional 1 red or suffer 1 damage to reveal card B .

819.text:
A thin, tired woman holds a broken radio, trying to open it with a screwdriver.

"For some reason it stopped working recently...

I'll try to fix it to pass the time until evening comes..." Choose 1: You may Unflip 1 card .

OR You may seal 2 cards to Unseal 1 chosen card .

820.text:
The fisherman examines every fish he caught, before letting them go, one by one.

"This one is innocent...

This one has never done me any harm..." From time to time, he hesitates and tosses a creature into the second basket – filled with pearls, salt-covered figurines, sponges, or underwater flowers.

And he murmurs: "This one is nasty.

Bit my toe, cast some vicious curses...

It deserves a miserable fate." Then, he glances over at us and we are drawn into conversation.

He notices our shoes and tells us that we can use them to surf on waves.

"But be wary, children, you may regret not taking the boat with you – the storm is relentless." He pats the side of his vessel.

"But I'm staying here and you're not worthy to borrow this gem.

The storm is approaching, it'll be here soon.

If I were you, I would visit the observatory first – many an adventurer have found their stars there.

I could lend you the map of this region, but you must pawn something precious." You may choose 1 Item (active or from the Storage) and place it under the Dream Gate tile to reveal card I (Ocean map) .

But beware, if you fail this Dream, you will lose this Item.

821.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

822.text:
The heavy oak door is sealed.

It mocks the rain and our efforts.

After a moment of struggle, we see that it's useless.

The door won't even budge.

But something glints out from a knothole high on the door.

Let's try and stretch...

Gain 1 gem .

823.text:
Check how many marker tokens are on the Dream Gate tile.

If you don't have 3 markers - the door won't budge.

Hurry! Try performing other actions from the A2 tile , there must be a way to open this door.

Stop reading now and go back.

If there are 3 marker , discard them and reveal tile Z - remember that when there are references to tiles within a Dream this is shorthand to take the specific tile of that dream - in this case retrieve Tile I-01 Z .

When you reveal this card, you can see that this tile has A3 in the top left corner so you can line it up with the board space (also marked A3 ) and place it down - it should go directly to the right of the starting Dreamscape map tile .

Then resolve - s.173 .

824.text:
Ship's log 14 .

I reminisce about my departure a long time ago.

I try to convince myself that the rocket blew up into a billion pieces just after lift-off instead of the Earth, that all that has happened in the intervening countless years in the cosmic void were only the dreams of a stray soul.

However when I look at my radar - it only detects small debris scattered everywhere at the coordinates.

I can see the familiar arrangement of stars and the Sun there but nothing more - no planet.

Only emptiness.

Each Dreamer suffers 1 damage or gains 1 Flaw .

Cross out the number on the "Reading the Ship's log" and write a new one: "777."

825.text:
Is it a train or the digestive system of a large worm crawling through an eroded underground tunnel? We feel burning pain every time we touch a wall or a seat.

This thing should not exist at all but it seems to be able to carry people.

Will we survive to the end of this journey? Each Dreamer must Seal 4 cards or roll the Luck die : luck-x = Suffer 3 damage .

luck-blank = Suffer 2 damage .

luck-1 / luck-2 / luck-3 = Suffer 1 damage .

At last, the train emerges from the endless tunnel – if you survived, resolve the Get on a Train script from the Dream Gate tile.

826.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

827.text:
Interesting that we even have spaceports...

I probably missed something.

The tourists look very strange, and I could swear that not everyone comesfrom Earth.

I see cyborgs, weird people dressed in shimmering suits, completely different guards to those in the city, mighty robots, and unusual, leashed animals.

Every minute a shiny line arcs across the sky – another departure or landing.

We can also buy unique vehicles here.

Settle any 1 Business from any spaces.

You may spend 1 gem to gain card B (Wing Glider) .

828.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

829.text:
We try to coax a smile to our lips, but do we even remember how those muscles work? A bright smile would disperse these mists, and maybe even draw a ray of sun from between the layers of cloud.

Come on, muscles! Budge! If you have the Little Things card, each Dreamer may Unflip 1 card .

Otherwise, nothing happens.

830.text:
We find a place hidden within the Great Sea, where peace and tranquility await us.

The clouds part and the celestial vault unravels before us – it looks like a canvas prepared with an azure dye, ready for a new session of artistic creation.

We wait patiently for the artist – the night – to appear.

As Nyx paints her deepening shades across the sky, newly-created stars start to dance in the firmament.

Gain card G (Orion's Belt) .

831.text:
If the card "Let's sail!" is not revealed , or if the current Turn Suit is not diamonds , we climb the mast skillfully.

But why do we do this? If the card "Let's sail!" is revealed and the current Turn Suit is diamonds , resolve the following: A wild squall blows.

What do we do? Trim the sail - s.205 Ease the sail - s.794 Ease the sail slightly - s.949

832.text:
"I knew it! I felt it.

Every night a filthy rat tries to sneak into the warehouse! This is going to be fun, at last something's happening to break up the monotony of the night watch.

A rough brawl is a good brawl.

Boys, the entertainment is here!" A lengthy whistle rings out, and bulky men run out of shady alleys.

Each Dreamer in range 1 suffers 1 damage and is Relocated to the start space.

833.text:
Is the Room space light ? Yes - s.689 No – When we look about us at the room we are in, safe and protected, hope creeps back to us.

But what's next? Remember that you can always come back to this script when the Room space is light .

834.text:
It is not the end.

This is not the Heart of the Underground yet.

The underground stretches on.

You may leave this room and move on - s.131 Or stay here for a while.

835.text:
With the help of the Locker, we climb even higher.

What is that? There are photos of this scarecrow thing, the toy that was lost long ago by the residents.

If the Locker is in this space – you may Spawn 1 Puppet or Relocate 1 Puppet to your space to gain card A .

Finally, you may Move the Locker 2 spaces or Relocate the Lamp to any tile .

836.text:
I don't know what we expected.

The death ray finally hits us.

A split second of light, heat, and pain, and then it's over.

Your Dreamer suffers 4 damage or gain 2 Flaws .

837.text:
The reaper once again swings its powerful, heavy scythe – the shadow of death sweeps over our heads for a moment.

This time, we seize our opportunity and shove it with all our might.

It tries to regain its balance on the edge of the platform, teetering for what feels like an eternity to us...

But the giant scythe unbalances it, and the monster finally topples into the abyss, silent until the very end.

So, is it over? We look down into the cosmic void.

But just below the platform is something much bigger – it's our planet.

We see destroyed cities, burned forests, dry seas – everything turned to desert.

Tall buildings bear the marks of big teeth that devoured everything that was once close to us.

We don't want to return to such a world...

Victory.

Each Dreamer gains 2 ether or Unseals 4 cards .

The Dreamer with the most Influence cards (in hand, deck, Discard pile, and active Progress zone) gains card E (We did it!) .

Restore 3 Shopping cards (II-41 C) .

Discard the current Dreamscape.

Add all Items and Influence cards of this Dream that you did not gain to the Item or Influence Market.

Remove from the game all cards and tiles of this Dream (except for those already gained by Dreamers or added to the game decks), as well as the Dream Gate tile of this Dream.

Gain tile II-40 J ("Beast, which ate the world" Dream Gate tile) .

Reveal the 2 Starting Slumber Map tiles and place the Dreamers in start spaces.

You are back on the Dreamworld Map.

838.text:
We've been chasing something for so many years.

Do we think that one day we will finally reach it? What price are we willing to pay? Do we even know what we are chasing? Maybe we had it all the time – within ourselves.

Maybe our payment is always made with this secret something from within, sacrificing part of it each time to chase fleeting shadows.

What is the truth and why do we live, what is the purpose of all these lifetimes? Nobody will answer us.

But if we're honest with ourselves, we do know it, and deep down we have always known.

Try to find it in yourself.

That's why you first went through the gate in this strange game, that's why you set out on an expedition and finally ended up here.

Remember why you are here and you'll be able to return to your forgotten home.

839.text:
Neither we nor the sail are prepared for this manoeuvre.

The boom hits us, sending us reeling and making us see stars! Choose one: Spend 3 yellow .

OR Suffer 1 damage and discard all cards from your hand.

Don't discard the current Turn card .

840.text:
Mom, keep an eye on me so nothing bad happens! The bad places start here but I have to go further, up to the school.

Reveal card F .

Place 1 marker on the 0 slot of the Risk track .

841.text:
To reach our goal, we must move on.

However, our saucer does not work — we can only beg the giants sitting around the table not to eat us yet and to help us travel onwards.

The price is always the same.

"And what do you have for me in exchange for my help, little people? Because I'm still ravenous.

Give me more food..." To appease the hunger of your hosts, you must give them something of your own.

But remember that you may lose it forever! Any 1 Dreamer chooses any element of the game that they own and decides to give it away.

This Dreamer resolves the script corresponding to the element they choose: any card/tile - s.129 any token/marker - s.521 any model - s.365 other - s.473

842.text: Which Deliverance Card did you use? Rage - s.1070 Intimidation - s.1033 Deception - s.1206 Understand - s.1136 Open yourself - s.1053

843.text:
The drawer is stuffed to the brim, mainly with garbage – almost nothing that is useful to us now.

I've only taken a single, unused match and put it in my pocket – just because of its kinship with light.

Draw 2 cards .

844.text:
Aha, there's something really interesting.

There's so much lumber down there! Maybe we could jump down.

You may Relocate your Dreamer to the start space to Restore 1 Item .

845.text:
Time stops.

The wave stands still like a huge wall, hiding the observatory behind.

Now we need to get through a glass door with a giant padlock.

The padlock bears two symbols – a spiral and a letter "N." If you have a Story token - s.272 If you don't, gain 1 gem or draw 2 cards .

846.text:
Bing bong! The doorbell rings, and we hear the shuffling of heavy steps and clumsy movements.

"I'm back.

I'm tired, and I'm not in the mood.

You'd better not tease me...

It's just fatigue, ok? Why all these questions?!" Reveal tile W (Box Knight) and Spawn Box Knight unless it's already in the Dreamscape.

847.text:
"Don't get in my way.

Buzz off! Are you playing the hero?" It won't be easy, and nobody will thank you for it.

So...

You may suffer 1 more damage to chase away the shadow – the child will return home safely.

Unfortunately, there is no reward.

No reward? So, is it worth the risk at all? Otherwise, the shadow will take the child.

Where to? Nobody will ever know.

848.text:
In one smooth motion, we rip off the actor's mask.

Rows of lamps light up, and we see that we are standing on a stage, and there are dozens of delighted people before us.

They rise to their feet in a standing ovation, and the deafening applause comes from every balcony, every chair, and even from behind doors.

It was a play all along...

We look at the actor who played the devil with relief – he stands up and bows.

A wide smile adorns his face.

The second player comes out from the wings – it's the protege – and also takes off his mask before bowing as well.

They look identical, like twins.

No one died, no one murdered anyone.

The only thing that ended was this play – and soon, another will begin.

So truly, Shakespeare had it right: "All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players." We can't wait to watch the next play, to discover its story.

We grab the silver crank and turn it to close the curtain.

It moves slowly and squeaks solemnly.

Victory.

Each Dreamer gains 1 ether .

Each Dreamer cures 1 damage or Unseals 2 cards .

Add card G (Creaking device) to the Fate deck.

Add tile II-37 X (Mortis) and tile II-38 N (Maskman) to the Slumber deck, if they are still available.

Gain card H (the 2nd Silver Key) .

Each Dreamer may choose 1 new Mask from the available Masks pool (along with its associated Mask card from II-41 S cards ).

Restore 3 Shopping cards (II-41 C) .

Change the Season to Ordinary Days .

Discard the current Dreamscape.

Remove from the game all cards and tiles of this Dream (except for those already gained by Dreamers or added to the game decks), as well as the Dream Gate tile of this Dream.

Reveal the 2 Starting Slumber Map tiles and place the Dreamers in start spaces.

You are back on the Dreamworld Map.

849.text:
Ship's log 09 .

I don't know what I was hoping for.

I am approaching the end of my journey, a boundary where nothing exists at all.

There is nothing further, and the giants' orbits are so infinitely far for any human.

It is dark and empty.

My body is barely functioning – hallucinations, breathing difficulties, hair falling out, skin peeling off.

I lost my sense of taste...

Humans are still miserable animals, ordinary, primitive organisms, whose place is on Earth, among its small earthly affairs.

It is not our time yet for the stars.

The barrier of the Solar System is our test, which for a long time will remain far beyond our capabilities.

For us, the cosmos turns out to be only a deadly void that will greedily devour its victims.

Each Dreamer suffers 1 damage or gains 1 Flaw .

Each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

Gain 1 Hour .

Cross out the number on the "Reading the Ship's log" and write a new one: "070."

850.text:
We haven't searched this box yet.

It looks interesting.

Look at the Pool of Items (cards B) and gain 1 of them.

Then, place a block token on this Map Action.

While we kneel over the box, something moves in the gap in the fractured floor.

We could swear that long, twisted hands emerge from the hole...

- Ifthis is a night space, place 1 threat in this space (max.

1 threat per space).

851.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

852.text:
"I don't like this.

I don't want to eat it." Nothing happens – take back this card.

853.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

854.text:
It's a page ripped from a book.

The engraving shows a decorative object, probably a mirror.

Well, it may prove useful.

Gain card D .

855.text:
A sudden gale causes a wave to swell.

We slide up the water, toward the stars – we're so close to them we could reach out...

In the distance, to the east, we see a still, huge wave looming over an observatory.

856.text:
Green fog blankets the streets and the dirty brick walls are braided with pipes like rusty vines.

We're in the Pipe District – you can't fall lower.

Many who couldn't find their place in the megacity paradise above, giving up the struggle for a more dignified life, now settle this area.

Like rats, they roam in the shadow of the gates, hugging its walls, afraid of contact with the light.

They are happy to buy back any waste from the Dream Factory.

We put masks on our faces to make the stench more tolerable.

Somewhere here lies the thing we came for.

"When you see IT , you will know that it is what I'm look for.

You must understand, someone with my social position can't go to such horrible a place.

Hurry up because I need THIS very much.

And as soon as I get THIS , the Silver Key will be yours," the Moon Baroness says, pointing to the drawer of her desk.

So on the evening of that same day, we arrived here.

857.text:
A countless variety of gates are scattered throughout the Endless City – and not just simple, wooden doors or metal gates to yards, but strange, exotic gates.

Portals to hidden places, different planes of existence, or other times such as tomorrow, or your first date.

But after much searching, we find a trace of what we are looking for – gates to the lower layers of dreams.

This could be it.

A passage was allegedly discovered twenty years ago in...

The Allotments.

Really?

858.text:
We thought that a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere was good for efficiency.

Well, we were wrong.

It was far too casual and too nice.

We have now reinstated control procedures and disciplined workers.

This isn't a club, it's a factory! Move marker to the gray space of the Workers track.

If the Union Leader is already revealed – it's over, resolve - s.157 If the Union Leader is not revealed , reveal card B and Spawn the Union Leader (use the Masked Man).

859.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

860.text:
The right dose – effective and risk-free.

The heart is back to normal, happily beating again and driving the Mill.

The swamp resumes its rapid growth, devouring the land.

Director Pig also rewards us with a few barrels of mud – though it's inconvenient to travel with them, so we surreptitiously dispose of them as soon as we're out of sight.

Victory.

Each Dreamer gains 1 ether .

Each Dreamer cures 2 damage or Unseals 2 cards .

Any Dreamer may discard 1 ether to gain card F (Mud Diving Equipment).

Add tile II-37 L (Rustle and Shadow) to the Slumber deck.

Gain card G (Deliverance Wisdom card).

Gain all cards II-34 L (Deliverance deck).

Hint : If at some point, you find that there are too many tiles in the Slumber deck, don't forget about Deliverance.

By the way, it turns out that not all monsters are what they seem.

Add all Items of this Dream that you did not gain to the Item Market.

Restore 3 Shopping cards (II-41 C).

Discard the current Dreamscape.

We didn't listen.

We walked down the winding stairs for hours, the walls becoming more and more decayed and wet.

In the dark distance, we saw a shipwreck cracked in half, protruding from a sea of mud.

890.text:
A week has gone by since we passed through the rift.

Nights last much longer than days here, the thick fog obscures everything.

The city is huge, like an endless maze.

Nothing here is ordinary.

We stay in bizarrely decorated hotels and fortunately nobody asks for payment.

Ironically, we have no need to sleep in them - it is however refreshing to feel the walls separating us from the chaos of the dreamworld.

Instead we spend our spare time planning our next forays and learning about the locals.

We've felt no hunger here either and even though we've tasted many strange foods, have gathered no nourishment from them.

There are some issues that plague us from time to time – sometimes our legs refuse to obey, becoming jelly-like at the worst possible moment; sometimes our mouths fuse together like that scene from an old horror film (what was it again?!) and sometimes our belongings mysteriously vanish into thin air only to reappear some time later.

The buildings here also have a mind of their own - we leave a room and when we come back, a different room has crept in and replaced it, doors and all.

Sometimes, peering out the window, new buildings pop up in front of our eyes.

People we meet sometimes transform before our eyes, their faces shifting from feature to feature, occasionally changing into someone familiar but not exactly placeable.

The sensation of deja-vu occurs very commonly here.

A double-decker taxi stops next to an old, closed market with a sign that reads: "Everything for free! But only at the highest prices!" Questioning a few of the strange locals in the area we managed to gain enough cryptic information to know that the one we are seeking - who might be able to help us answer a few questions about this strange city - disappeared a few days ago in this old run down marketplace.

The taxi driver thanks us and drives away without taking payment.

We wonder why the driver spends her days chauffeuring lost souls around.

Perhaps like Sisyphus they are compelled into an eternity of toil.

We easily sneak through a hole in a rusty chain-link fence and start investigating, trying to find clues in the impenetrable darkness...

910.text:
Ship's log 05.

I'm still alive, but what's next? What about Alice? What about my family? Did anyone die? Has anyone survived? What if I am completely alone now? I am still drifting through space.

There is silence, but it's deeper than just the absence of sound.

It is like an emptiness of the soul, of my very thoughts.

Like death.

Or maybe I didn't escape? Maybe it didn't work out and the ship was torn to shreds? Or maybe we didn't lift off at all? Crashes sometimes occur during the launch...

perhaps all that remain are the debris of my rocket lying in the field on the spaceport - my unconscious soul wandering in space? No matter, right now I travel the cosmos - I see the ocean of stars and slowly approach the Moon.

Except that I don't see any orbital station.

It's not on the radar.

No signal, no trace.

Everything indicates that it was destroyed.

What now? Turn back or set a new course? But it will be months or years of inert flight.

I may survive, but what then? I calculate a new course, enter the coordinates of the orbits of subsequent planets.

I can succeed.

My rocket will move away and then turn around Jupiter using its gravity as a slingshot.

This manoeuvre will take...

two years.

And another two back.

No one has ever made such a flight.

I have enough oxygen, food, and water but I know that's not all I need to survive.

But it can succeed.

The decision is made.

I change course.

Space awaits...

It is said that photos do not lie.

This pile of photos represents one life.

The door is open and it's silent inside.

Monstrous anger boils under her skin, ready to erupt at any moment.

This street animates simple objects into something alive, something more than alive.

In our world, things also came alive sometimes - mainly, just before their 'death' - before being thrown away.

An old beloved car after buying a new one.

A trusty backpack.

An old apartment full of memories.

Even a favourite t-shirt.

This crate isn't a simple crate.

We shouldn't place our dirty hands on its delicate, wooden skin right away - it would be rude.

The ocean is always beautiful - sometimes as still as a picture, sometimes full of awe-inspiring power.

But here, we find a festering wound - heaps of rubbish floating on the water, spilling their oily blood that taints the once-pure waters.

There's no life in here, this ocean is dead.

It's not a place we want to cross on foot.

When time stops, we feel lonely, even in a crowded room.

There is no escape from this state.

Another dying house, another withering life, more messed up photos, forgotten chairs on which no one is sitting anymore, dirty basements full of forlorn memories, empty and stinking rooms...

Only the clock is still alive, ruthlessly chewing at the oncoming hours and days.

"Did you forget who I used to be?" The Locker asks bitterly.

The barely glowing Lamp nods sadly with its lampshade.

"And you forgot that nobody cares today? It's your fault, you've never admitted it." "You aren't innocent either, better look in the mirror," the Locker responds before shutting its doors for good.

It works, the key fits! We open the wooden door and go inside...

We are in a small room with walls painted blue.

Cobwebs run across the room like curtains.

Nobody has been here for a long time.

We stumble over empty cans and boxes littering the floor.

There are several plush toys lying on a dirty bed: a teddy bear, a doll with a broken arm, a puppet with a long beard...

but taking any of them is impossible because someone sewed them to the mattress.

We look around for a moment, but there's actually nothing here.

Disappointed, we leave, closing the door behind us...

Resolve - s.268 .

The four-story block stretches along the streets endlessly, colourful window lights create a mosaic in the night landscape.

The yellow light of street lamps tints stone pavements and trees are rustled by a light breeze.

It's so peaceful...

And yet, as soon as we look more closely, we notice the shadows hiding in the nooks and back alleys: a cinder of a cigarette in a doorway, a choked scream in the distance, the tangible fear of a child returning home too late or the shuffling of a sick dog who has not yet lost hope of finding a new human owner.

Sometimes someone goes There, rarely someone or something arrives Here.

When we try looking far away, toward the horizon, we see only fog.

It obscures the view, but also the distant truth.

There are things described in many leaflets around the docks - but are these notes true? Maybe someday we will see it for ourselves.

Everything is vague and unclear, bizarre and ambiguous.

And there are wardens who ensure things stay this way.

The fog thins a little, revealing wet cobblestone.

It's night - as always.

something has changed.

Is winter approaching slowly? I like winter...

I'll watch TV for a while, and then I should go to sleep.

Oh." "Right, it's getting late...

we already have it in our hands and open it slowly.

The wall breaks.

Subconsciously, we know that probably no one wanted to discover what lay beyond it.

A void frozen in time awaits on the other side - through the looking glass to the dark corner of every soul - where the cold truth about everything and everyone lies hidden.

Discovering it though would be akin to seeing the emotionless raw code - the wizard behind the curtain - instead of the beautiful illusion of the world it tried to create.

With resigned trepidation, we pass to the threshold of the void.

Next to us, a small garden floats, spinning slowly like a weary ballet dancer pirouetting on the brink of a stage.

A single, ancient dead tree stands in the middle of the ruined garden, leaning over a pair of lovers.

They don't move, frozen in time.

They will never will never understand that they were nothing more than the imperfect transient thought of a solitary soul - that they were never born and will never die, will never lived and will never be separated.

There is much beauty and ephemerality in the idea of these traces of memory decaying, haunting the present but never invoking the future.

We leave a dying light behind and plunge into the endless void.

The only thing that still exists here is our own path - disintegrating, shaky, barely visible but definitely surmountable.

Remove all 6 Silver Key cards from the game.

999.text:
We see the light, pale and dim - it hurts our eyes after being in such deep darkness.

Can it be...? Can we succeed? We look around - we're now in some white room.

This world is unusually gray and ordinary - we haven't seen anything like this for a long time.

We try several times to use our powers - only to find that we can't.

Are we finally back in the old, recovered reality? Have the dreams and nightmares finally ceased? Is everything back as it was before? The images come to us - all those strange dreams that we dreamed, all those paths which finally brought us here.

These memories start disappearing like smoke in the wind.

We feel our memories changing, reshaping to what was before ...

And the catastrophe...

What catastrophe? Strange memories barely loom on the edge of oblivion - silver keys, mysterious walls and gates, scary beasts...

Why are we strapped to our beds in a hospital room? Was it all just madness and strange dreams? We try to move, but the belts are holding tight.

Yet we are relieved to see the world around us - everything exists normally as it should.

We did it...

What did we just do? It's hard to remember anything.

We had a nightmare about the end of the world, but it was only a nightmare, we need to pull ourselves together - maybe therapy, drugs, and a long rest will help us.

Resolve - s.364 .

1000.text:
Spectres have always wandered this cold corridor.

Human shadows - each damaged in a different way, but all incapable of existing in the real world outside.

Because you need to know that the spectre is a human who, deep down, has given up.

They desire nothing anymore, no longer dream about anything and want to change nothing, because they know it's too late to start anything new.

It's a lie though.

You may not be able to relive the past but you can learn to live your new life well.

There is really nothing under your mask - you can be whoever you want to be any day.

Each day gives us thousands of moments.

Each one can be groundbreaking, different, amazing.

There is much more to you than you think.

Gain 2 Hours or gain 1 ether .

1001.text:
I'm at home again, in my safe place where I can hide.

I don't have to leave.

Time doesn't exist here, and nobody can see me.

I'll wait a little longer here...

Just one more moment.

It's just a strange dream, it seems so funny in the morning.

It makes me laugh - like everything around.

Remove all your Flaw cards.

1002.text:
The electric shock causes my thoughts to fade for a moment, and as my brain slowly reboots, I hear the click of the switch again - and once again, the lightning bolts rush through my mind.

These are ordinary medical treatments, all to make the world whole again - because you can't live in an unstable world that is constantly shaking, where you can gain something one moment only to lose everything the next.

You can't live in a world where everything is so fragile.

Gain 1 ether .

1003.text:
The huge reveller turns to us.

"Hey, little ones, I have an idea.

Let's do a contest! Listen to me..." Each Dreamer may play only once: Place 1 damage from the damage pool (if there are any) in any space of A3 on the Dreamworld Map.

Flick it in such a way as to make it land on any space of C3 on the Dreamscape.

If you succeed - Unseal 3 cards or Block 1 Step on the current Turn card.

Discard that damage from the Dreamscape.

If you don't - suffer that damage .

Warning: You can't clear up the board before starting this contest.

1004.text:
"Let me share my pain with you," the wraith whispers when we come closer.

It's a sunny day, we walk along the sidewalk in the city center.

It's scorching hot.

A shadow of a man lies on the side of the road, searing pain splitting his chest.

It's nothing compared to the fear of never seeing his daughter again.

He extends his hand to a passer-by.

"Buzz off, drunkard!" he hears our voice in response.

Suffer 1 damage .

Continue the Slumber.

1005.text:
Why does this blue door still haunt us? What could be inside? Each player should close their eyes and, for a whole minute, imagine whatever could be beyond the blue door .

Then, each player should describe what they imagined.

Choose the story that was the most moving.

If you manage to choose only 1 - s.009 .

If you cannot reach an agreement - each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

1006.text:
Why do I still see this tunnel and the light at its end? I am not there, I am here! But why can I still feel its chill? I have to run outside, soak up the sunlight.

Laugh and play to forget this dark void.

It's wonderful to live! Gain 1 ether .

1007.text:
Fear overcomes the filthy degenerates at the first word we shout.

They flee into cool shadows, cramming into narrow passages between dreams.

They will come back, but how fast? It depends on us.

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

1008.text:
Some of them allow us to pass, but we see that not everyone is friendly.

They also differ from each other - each of them is a different world, agreeing with one, disagreeing with the other.

If we had stayed here longer, maybe we would have understood more.

You may end this Slumber (without Victory or Failure).

If not, continue the Slumber.

1009.text:
I've lived in hell for many years - every day was like a year without end, and each year seemed to drag on for eternity.

From morning until evening, when this state of mercy was interrupted for a moment, my flexible body gradually turned into stone and steel.

All dreams withered in a second, like cut flowers.

Only one thought gave me some strange hope - hell must end somewhere.

I want to go outside, come back for only one purpose - to ruthlessly cleanse the world of evil, like the hand of fate.

So, it worked - I'm no longer a human being.

Now I am an instrument of a higher force.

Cure 3 damage or gain 1 ether .

1010.text:
The masked monsters wait for our move.

They make welcoming grunts and encourage us with their dirty claws to come closer.

We want to approach them, but we recoil at their acidic smell.

At a moment's notice, the faceless creeps can become hostile again.

If you don't perform any Assault action this Turn, Faceless Creeps won't perform any Steps this Turn.

Continue the Slumber.

1011.text:
I didn't like coming to that old, decaying house.

Everything here was dirty and decaying, cut off from the living world and waiting helplessly for the end.

Obsolete equipment, old furniture, boring books, pitiful souvenirs - like barely-collected crumbs from the table belonging to other people's blooming lives.

How was all this rubbish going to encourage anyone to visit? And those pathetic pictures meant to conjure up the past when we were all together - while we still had time for it.

There was a certain lonely creature in them all, who waited each day with fading hope.

But I never had time.

You may suffer 1 damage to gain 1 ether .

1012.text:
Each of us was a specialist in our field.

We have spent our entire lives in our small artificial world - the laboratory - protected from the raging and unstable worlds nearby.

We spent our entire lives deepening our knowledge and exercising our willpower - all to prepare ourselves for this trip.

Now, it is difficult to remember which of us was actually a psychologist, physicist, or survival specialist.

There seems to be little left of these memories.

But that's not all.

Each of us had a completely different, 'normal' life before the cataclysm happened.

This old life, and the tragedies we experienced in them, allowed us to accumulate the enormous energy necessary to survive in the unstable world of whirling dreams.

They even allowed us to preserve fragments of our old knowledge and memories, however elusive they may be.

Ironically, what has marked us so painfully has become our special gift.

1013.text:
It reminds me of my first office, my student days, the very beginnings.

Sensory deprivation tank in the basement, solitude in the attic, and the crazy beginnings of research - chaotic but relentless.

I remember the first real transition - at first, I didn't even know I was dreaming - everything was so real and familiar, yet different.

The view outside the window changed, yet I recognized specific places.

The streetcar ran as usual - but it was not on the tracks, it was hovering high above the ground.

I saw the city centre, but the buildings were many times larger and seemed to change constantly.

The air was filled with grotesque vehicles.

The colourful glow of light separated the streets and neighborhoods, and a dense fog ran down the cobblestones of the streets.

Then I realized that I was not alone in the room.

Alice, my younger sister, was sitting in the armchair and reading a book...

How could I forget about her? Maybe because we never had the chance to meet there, on the other side.

Gain card II-41 W (Ghost from the past) .

1014.text:
Someone had a sick sense of humor building this coffin-shaped ship.

Who would like to sail a coffin? What sea could encourage the use of such a vessel? It's just a dream sea.

Farther beyond its borders lies black empty waters and some barely visible unknown lands.

It is better not to go there because we do not know what awaits us.

Although...

Funny, land is just land, known or unknown - what's the difference? Have none of us really been there? Then why do I feel as if I know exactly what's over there? Oh, what's this? A nice trinket, just wipe the mud off it first! Gain 1 ether .

1015.text:
We look far into the sparkling sea horizon.

What lies beyond this impenetrable border is not known but something tells us that we must have come from there.

Maybe it is because that's where we come from - we are strangers, invaders - and this world wants to annihilate us at all costs.

You may Relocate the Team to any Location on the Dreamworld Map or Restore 3 Items .

Each Dreamer gains 1 ether .

1016.text:
The child smiles when, at last, we agree to play with it.

It was rough-housing all the time in order to get our attention? But it's not just about having fun.

We stop to really live in the moment - to see again for the first time since forever.

It's hard to go on without hiding behind the right mask.

But when we can take it off for a moment, we can really breathe.

Victory.

This Slumber ends.

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

We found a new friend.

Add tile II-38 J (Mischievous Child) to the Slumbers deck.

1017.text:
"It won't happen, I'm safe," we assured ourselves while crossing a bridge over a river - the boards were in excellent condition.

And yet we couldn't stop imagining falling into the frigid waters.

We didn't listen to that irrational whisper and as if our fears had powers of their own, the wood broke under our weight.

Why do we remember this now? And why does the gaze of the candle seem so piercing? Gain 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1018.text:
That empty house again - wallpaper peeling off cracked walls, squeaky chairs and dirty furniture.

Again, I missed the time.

None of us managed to be here on time.

Gain 1 ether .

1019.text:
How to turn back time? Sometimes we want to go back many years, sometimes only a few seconds.

A few seconds before the mystery of the broken glass began, before the world began to spin in a dance, when the earth changed places with the sky, and the sky fell straight under the wheels.

Two entangled souls sped rapidly into the future and then one suddenly stopped.

The quiet rhythmic beats so close to my heart that then receded forever, becoming slower and slower, until finally there was only an endless pause.

The pain wasn't the worst.

The worst part was the end of reality, behind which the gates of hell slowly opened.

And the fear that there would be some 'tomorrow' after today.

Red snakes swirled in the broken glass, the wheel spun like a flying circus, slower and slower.

Only the ruby-red gasoline was dripping slowly.

Gain 1 Hour .

Gain 1 ether .

1020.text:
We grab our enemy and begin to choke his throat without mercy.

He tried to get in our way - enough of this! All restrictions on our freedom are equally bad.

We will not allow them.

Others do not count - if they make us lose even a fraction of our liberty, they will regret it.

Our freedom is sacred, and there is no price for it! And yet the guard who is lying helpless continues to laugh...

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

1021.text:
This factory seems so familiar...

I go to work almost automatically - it won't get done with me sitting in bed.

There is no need to rest, as rest is for wimps.

A real tough guy is not afraid of hard work.

This is what he lives for - only cowards and weaklings run away from real, hard work.

A decent stand-up person is never ashamed of it.

Well, you'll get a little dirty, sure - but you can be proud.

And then I need to rest a bit, have fun, give myself a moment.

I have to somehow relax before the next day.

After all, it's my money, I earned it myself, and no one will tell me what to do with it.

Gain card II-41 V (Fever) .

1022.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1023.text:
Why can't it understand that we have to get there? Our rage builds up, and we start daring the conductor.

It also loses control over itself, and, in a fierce tussle, we push it off the train.

We hear fading curses and a promise of punishment.

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

Things will get worse from now on.

Remove tile X1 (Conductor) from the game.

From now on, you'll be using tile X2 in the Train Dream.

1024.text:
The city I used to live in was changing every year, new generations appeared, cars took on more and more new shapes, some buildings fell apart to make room for others.

Few of the places lasted - like the old corner shop.

It was there when I was a child, it was still there when I was old.

I liked to look there - you never knew what you would find on one of the shelves full of different junk each time.

It was like an unarranged museum - you could search it from morning to night, all your life, and every day you would find new wonders worth living for.

Gain 1 ether .

1025.text:
The machine is scary.

It's cruel and ruthless.

But it must have a purpose, as all things that were made.

It follows us everywhere, sometimes marking its presence in a very painful way.

When we stop fighting it, the machine approaches and we can look at it closely.

Then we discover that we were the ones who built it.

We regain control over it and find out it's actually a really useful contraption.

Victory.

This Slumber ends.

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

We found a real treasure.

Add card II-41 E (The Machine) to the Fate deck.

1026.text:
Many have probably wondered what is hidden inside this beast.

I know there's nothing there.

It is simply a soulless and powerful nothing with no feelings.

It doesn't care about people, it just moves forward like a steamroller.

Uncaringly, it will crush everything, you cannot argue with it, you cannot outsmart or bribe it.

It is a blind and ruthless fate.

Pray that it will not turn its gaze upon you.

Gain 1 ether .

1027.text:
The shadows deepen with each strike.

"Stop, just stop," the shadow weeps.

But we can't - we have to strike it one more time as our fists don't bleed enough yet.

We want to be truly hurt! Before we know it, we start weeping along with the shadow, grieving over our pathetic souls.

Suffer 1 damage .

Continue the Slumber.

1028.text:
"I'm sorry...

I was just like everyone else, I was only thinking about myself.

Now I see a little more clearly but it's too late.

Forgive me." The man was begging us for help.

He wanted us to call his little girl but we thought he was another drunkard lying on a pavement.

He would probably never find her, but let's give him some company during his hopeless search.

The wraith looks at us curiously but doesn't say a word.

"We'll look for her together," we say.

A sad look and a slight nod of agreement.

Victory.

This Slumber ends.

1029.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1030.text:
We shout at the roaring iron machine.

It's like shouting at the churning sea in powerless rage - it's futile and there is no effect.

The machine approaches us ruthlessly.

Gain 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1031.text:
We chase them away, but they come back.

These reminders of our guilt will hunt us down forever.

Suffer 1 damage .

Continue the Slumber.

1032.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1033.text:
The dogs stand before us, guttural growls resonating in their throats.

They smell our fear, but they also smell our hostility.

We don't trust them, they're just primitive animals, but this stand-off is still better than open conflict.

If each Dreamer Seals 2 cards , end this Slumber (without Victory or Failure).

If not, continue the Slumber.

1034.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1035.text:
We run up the stairs as fast as possible...

And then, it looks like we can go even faster.

We start to slide along the steps, and after a while, we are basically hovering over them, only holding onto the railing.

Wow, this is awesome! Gain card C (Stairs) .

Each other Dreamer gains 1 ether .

1036.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1037.text:
We stand over a shapeless mass of flesh.

Our clothes are soaked in blood, our skin stinks horribly.

But we feel a little purer and lighter.

We got rid of something that weighed heavily on our hearts and tempted us to do vile things.

What we abhor in others is sometimes the most difficult to eradicate in ourselves.

You won't do it all at once, but it's always a step forward.

Victory.

This Slumber ends.

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

Gain card II-34 G (Growth).

1038.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1039.text:
They try copying us when we imitate them.

We circle around our languages, customs, and needs, but can't find any foothold to base our deception on.

It feels as if they know us really quite well or they're just making fun of us.

You can cheat them once or twice, but not for the rest of your life.

Each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1040.text:
I'm safe here.

This is my colorful world, no one will hurt me here.

Here, I have my powerful friends with powers so mighty that no one can hurt me.

Friends, he's coming again - help me! Defend me! Gain 1 ether .

1041.text:
The foetid stench of the locker's breath almost knocks us out.

Its clingy and imposing nature is similar to those aggravating snots who always want to tell us they know more or we can do something better.

Nothing in this closet belongs to us.

Inside, we only see the hated wisdom and beliefs of others, their knowledge, experiences, pain, and joy.

But are we not more enlightened and experienced than all of them? All this is probably rubbish that we do not need.

We know better.

Do we already understand what it is? Gain 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1042.text:
I love masks - they are colourful and funny, full of life.

And they offer a sense of safety.

They are not fake at all - quite the opposite.

It's the mask that reveals to me who I am.

After all, we always have to invent ourselves so as not to be ordinary shapeless nothings.

We are born with a mask, and then choose to modify it or look for a new one.

Take it off, and you'll see that there's nothing underneath! Gain a number of ether equal to the number of Masks owned .

1043.text:
Sometimes we work great as a team.

Remember this old advice: "let's focus on what unites us, not on what separates us." It's so simple and so easily forgotten.

You may Seal 3 cards - if you do, each other Dreamer cures 3 damage .

If you play solo , cure 3 damage .

1044.text:
The guard is more than he seems.

He always accompanies us, whether we like it or not, preventing us from achieving our goals.

We do not live alone in the world, not every dream can be fulfilled at once.

And that is his job - to make us question ourselves before we make plans, to safeguard us from doing something stupid.

That's the world and it's sometimes better not to change it.

Accept the obstacles, move around them.

But know you won't be able to change the rules.

At least not while he's around.

Gain 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1045.text:
The mask is always the same, cold and emotionless, but the faces beneath it are constantly changing.

Here is the subservient executor of hideous commands, never refusing, eternally loyal.

Here is a priest who has long since lost his faith.

Here is the forger who signed the stolen work.

Here is a drunkard father whose child was kidnapped.

Here is the mother who sacrificed another's child to save hers.

Here is a man who belittles and tortures others for his own pleasure.

Faces change but the mask is perfect, hiding all.

Your Dreamer gains a new Mask - choose 1 from the Mask pool (and gain its Mask card from the Secrets - see cards II-41 S) .

Each other Dreamer gains 1 ether .

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

1046.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1047.text:
How long has it been since our group left the fading microcosm of our laboratory and embarked on the crazy journey into the Dreamlands? There were six of us, but one of us was lost at the very beginning - what's worse, now we can't even remember who it was.

Even if we met them here we probably wouldn't recognise them again.

Sometimes we split up, only to meet again later, but how many of us will make it to the end? This might not be our first trip - we may have already undertaken it many times, but without success.

This might just be another desperate attempt - the memories soon to be lost to the tides of time.

1048.text:
A long time ago, our dreams were purer and innocent.

We enjoyed childish pranks and little lies but never with ill-intent, always just to have a little fun.

Now we deceive to get ahead, to survive and compete - nobody laughs about it anymore.

"Hey, I'm here," the child calls.

"I think you lost something, ha ha!" Discard all Keys and all Active Items .

Continue the Slumber.

1049.text:
Synthetic archives GAP3077/04: The Final Frontier.

How to alter reality? How could we build a better world without suffering and full of happiness? In dreams, we don't have a problem with that - but here in this "real" stable world we share with others there are so many barriers to achieving this.

The Final Frontier - a great challenge, a scientific project that eventually destroyed the world.

The results of the study were bleak at first.

We were searching for the difference between the world of dreams and what we called reality, and slowly understood that there was no difference.

A study by our scientists suggested that the Dream world was less real.

What was more surprising was that when the exact research methodology was replicated by scientists on the other side the conclusion was exactly the opposite - that our waking world was "less real".

It looked like we were our own mirror images.

The only differences being that our world was more stable and the Dream world possessed greater powers of creation.

We were able to move between these two worlds without any problem.

However this was not enough for us.

We desired to control completely this power of creation.

Because it was shared with billions of other dreamers everything here was the average of all that we believed in, what we wanted and what we were afraid of.

And then, the ESC developed the first prototype of the Key.

The principle was that if you could isolate your part of the dreamworld, you could change it to a limited extent and forcibly bring your dreams into reality.

We strengthened our frequencies surpressing those belonging to others and after suffering a miserable beginning, the door was finally opened.

The rest was merely a technology race.

Coupled Keys, reinforced Keys, accelerated Keys, i-Keys.

Technology quickly became obsession.

Everyone wanted to maximise their own individual control over creation and Dreams.

This technology was not cheap so ordinary people could not afford even the cheapest and weakest of Keys, becoming slaves of worlds created by others.

Reality was greeted with new wonders - bigger with every passing day, grander and more amazing than ever before.

It became full of realised dreams.

Unfortunately it also resembled the dreamworld more and more.

Individual new worlds became so separate that, in the end, nothing distinguished them from ordinary dreams.

There was no longer one shared reality - it had fractured into nothing more than countless, infinite microcosms.

So my belief when it comes to the Great Disaster was that no one really attacked us.

It wasn't a meteorite, or sun flares, nor from any divine judgement.

This force was too powerful and we weren't ready to control it.

It was no one but outselves, in all of our folly and hubris, who destroyed our own world.

1050.text:
"Behind you!" we shout, trying the oldest trick in the book.

And the degenerates fall for it! We steal everything from them while they are distracted ...

which really means nothing, as they don't actually have anything.

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

1051.text:
My faithful little helpers.

I don't know what I would have done without you in these difficult times.

Only you understand me.

We understand each other so well...

When someone upsets me, you always support me with your strength.

When something bothers me, you give me courage.

When I am fed up with everything, you help me forget my worries and enter restful dreams.

But why do you sometimes hurt my family when I'm asleep? It might not be you at all.

But...

Can I count on you today? Get out of your bottle, come on, I really need your help.

Gain 1 ether .

1052.text:
The candle is gone and so is our rage.

It's so dark and cold in here now.

We feel uncertain.

What hides in the shadows? Will we fall down when we take a step forward? Why do we feel so lost?! The light hidden deep within us has gone out.

We took it for granted and rarely appreciated it, as it was elusive and inconstant and yet without it we have lost our direction.

We move as if in a fog.

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

Things have changed, and not for the better.

Add card II-41 H (The Malevolent Candle) to the Fate deck.

1053.text:
We decide to let our guard down and we open ourselves to the rabid dogs.

They hesitate, confused but then approach us and let us touch them.

We discover a way to communicate with them - by gentle words, eye contact, and calming rubs.

Even though we're so different from the creatures, we share a mutual desire for safety and security.

Victory.

This Slumber ends.

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

It was a precious experience.

Add tile II-38 L (Friendly Dogs) to the Slumbers deck.

1054.text:
Sometimes a seemingly insignificant detail unlocks something we didn't even realise.

Like this one here...

It was so long ago at the Clinic.

That year our research had moved much further ahead, entering forbidden and dangerous areas beyond the boundaries of ethics and science.

Having studied dreams for many years, we were still barely scratching the surface of the real mystery - the ultimate dream, the eternal sleep - otherwise known as death.

We had already collected countless descriptions of its vestibule - tunnels and light, scenes from our lives flashing before our eyes, the shadows of loved ones and guides encountered - but it was difficult to conclude whether this was anything more than a biochemical reaction of the brain to the critical state when its functions faded away.

Something really important happened that day.

The test object completely passed the door of Death, passed over to the other side...

and returned.

They came back to tell us about what they saw there.

I'd had a sense of what this secret was for some time but could not confirm my suspicions ...

until now.

Remove all your Flaw cards .

1055.text:
It's hard to get the words out, but I need to know: "Where did you get this yellow jacket?" "Don't remember.

I've always had it." "You must tell me! Listen, this is very important.

Where did you get this?" "My mom bought me it." - The kid smiles sadly, but calmly.

Gain 1 ether .

1056.text:
This war is our apocalypse...

when we look at the dark shadows on the empty bench, we understand what it means - the end of everything that has ever existed.

Everything, at least for us.

When your life ends, and you are gone - this is your own apocalypse.

Each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

Gain 3 Hours .

1057.text:
We become nothing but living rage.

We don't want to remember it anymore - webs of memories, painful stings that keep coming back like spider bites.

Where are our foes? We want to squash something but the spiders are gone.

Victory.

This Slumber ends.

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

Gain card II-34 I (Hate) .

1058.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1059.text:
Yellow eyes glisten in the tunnel, rarely blinking.

Is it an oncoming train? The rails come out of the tunnel and disappear into the fog.

Here, everything is surrounded by dense mists that delimit places and permeate everything.

They devour the surroundings in front of our eyes as if wanting to erase everything from existence.

The oppressiveness of the mists sometimes feels as though they are there to punish us.

We feel the weight of the suitcases.

Oh what the hell, on an impulse, we throw them toward the yellow eyes.

The lights disappear in the dark.

Each Dreamer may discard 1 Baggage .

Distribute all available gem between Dreamers.

1060.text:
Suddenly the phone rings, the one on the table next to the window.

"Yes?" "Hello, did you order the pest control service?" Choose 1: - Discard all Rats.

- Each Dreamer may gain 1 Flaw to gain 1 ether .

1061.text:
A glimpse of salvation makes the shadow open its heart before us ...

it's so naive! We feel almost sorry for it when we steal its hopes once again.

Each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1062.text:
It's difficult but we're beginning to see the boundaries of colliding dreams - our own and those we visit.

They are often shrouded in fog but as soon as we notice any anomaly, the borders begin to immediately morph and disappear, as if they were 'repairing' the perceived fault.

It's also difficult to remember these anomalies as the memory also begins to blur, inconsistencies correcting themselves.

But now that we know about them, we can try to explore them further - it's hard, but we already know where to look.

1063.text:
When we think of them, we feel dread.

Our body breaks out in a cold sweat, our hands are numb and clammy, we can't think clearly.

Fear has a crippling power and we need to overcome it.

But are these fears real? Do these creatures exist outside or are they manifestations directly from within us? Understanding is the basis.

And we already know that today is a good day to fight fire with fire.

Gain 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1064.text:
This lab reminds me of something.

It was a long time ago.

In one year of our research, the laboratory was already able to test over ten thousand sleeping volunteers, gather accurate data from the course of each cycle, transcribe countless memories, and conduct even more experiments.

Dreams were more than just dreams - their realities became not so different from our world.

More and more, we began to notice a completely separate category of dreams, or rather 'gates' to another world.

Volunteers awoke there and led their second lives as their usual ones and alarmingly began treating their real lives, here in the waking world, as just dreams.

After 'awakening' in that other world, their second memory immediately returned.

Many felt at home there - even though they had completely different families, jobs, appearances and names.

That world was similar to ours but even so it seemed that the development of their civilization moved in a slightly different direction than ours.

Some people didn't even want to return from there.

So far we've been able to bring everyone back.

However the sleeping figure in front of us was not responding to the awakening program.

We couldn't get her to wake up.

Her brain worked intensely while dreaming but her body lay limp, clutching a toy - a small puppet dressed in a yellow coat.

Gain 1 ether .

1065.text:
Every day we wear masks, so putting on another is as easy as breathing.

A blank slate covers our face, making us look like these creeps.

They lose their interest in us and go away.

We want to smile, but can't.

Our neck is tired of lifting so many visages.

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

We made things worse.

Add tile II-38 D (Fearsome Faceless Creeps) to the Slumbers deck.

1066.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1067.text:
I do not want to see you again! Get lost forever...

I don't want to make difficult decisions anymore, I don't want to make mistakes and suffer the consequences.

I just want you to leave me alone! Torn pieces of cardboard fall to the floor...

You may suffer 3 damage to end this Slumber with a Victory.

If not, continue the Slumber.

1068.text:
Nothing lasts forever.

Happiness may end one day, of course, but the worst pain will also eventually pass - one way or another.

Sometimes, the sun finally rises and drives out the darkness, and sometimes, we see a faint glow of new hope.

Sometimes, the system just burns out, the void swallowing everything and the soul rises freely for the first time in a long time.

It's just a matter of waiting it out, even when everything seems impossible, when we're trapped in a frozen moment.

Cure 2 damage or gain 1 ether .

1069.text:
Synthetic archives GAP3077/05: Lost in a lost world.

We've lost control - reality has fallen apart.

We've turned it into countless, separate dreams - there is nothing else beyond them.

No one can predict how long such a state could last - hundreds or thousands of years, because time has been diminished to just another, insignificant dimension.

And yet within each shard of reality exist smaller groups of consciousness, inhabitants who try to recreate what was once our lost world with incomplete memories.

Fragment by fragment, details being rebuilt limited by their own powers of creation.

And on top of this they must defend themselves against interlopers who could destroy their noble efforts, absorbing them into their own dreams.

Now groups of scientists trapped in the bubbles of artificial worlds are trying to find a way to restore the common world through the search for an essential missing element.

If we find it, we'll finally be able to restore our forgotten real world step by step, expanding its borders and nullifying the chaotic powers that exist outside.

And maybe, just maybe, one day we'll really be home again.

Where to start our search? Let's start with the most powerful, distinct dream worlds that can trap and transform newcomers.

They contain a secret of the lost stability.

It's a risky mission because, by joining someone's dream you inevitably become part of it.

You can easily lose your existing memories, knowledge and turn into just another puppet subject to the will of the ruler of such a world.

However, we have our own methods and technology that can help us.

And we have nothing to lose...

1070.text:
The dogs whimper and run away without any hesitation - it seems they are used to it.

Was our outburst right? Should we flail our fists at them? They wouldn't understand anything else - they're just dogs, right? We're not going to listen to their constant pointless barking.

This Slumber ends (without Victory or Failure).

Remove this Slumber tile from the game.

Something has changed.

For the worse.

Add tile II-38 M (Fearsome Dogs) to the Slumbers deck.

1071.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1072.text:
He's a mischievous and ungrateful brat! His head is all messed up, I don't think he's ever serious.

Just let me get him, he'll remember it! Come here, now! Where is he again? You may end this Slumber (without Victory or Failure).

Gain 1 ether .

1073.text:
"Don't try this with me," the shapeless whispers.

"Or do you want to see what real deception looks like?" Suddenly, the monster takes my form except with an ugly crooked smile and a repulsive, ghastly appearance.

Then, I realize it's a mirror.

Each Dreamer gains 1 gem .

Continue the Slumber.

1074.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1075.text:
It's time to take a look at this strange artifact made of some black crystal.

The eye on it attracts my attention the most.

When I examine it, the pupil enlarges and seems to pull me into its gaze.

For a moment, I become a reflection inside the crystal itself.

Inside the crystal room I open a doorway in front of me and see hundreds of mirrored walls - multiplying endlessly to an infinite sequence of doors, each leading to a different, separate world.

At this moment, I remember the closest of those worlds and the memories of some of the lives I had lived or that I would eventually live come flooding into my mind.

It is endless.

Overwhelming.

I jump back to my body and find myself holding the strange artifact in my hand.

Block 1 Step on the current Turn card.

Discard 1 Morphing or discard all threat from the Dreamscape.

1076.text:
There is no secret here.

Did you enter the correct number?

1077.text:
We pluck different strands of spiderwebs, we set traps by cutting holes in them, we change our scents by bathing in mud.

All this to distract their attention and gain us some time.

Gain 1 Hour .

Continue the Slumber.

1078.text:
If a person can turn into a rat over the course of their life, then maybe with time, they can also change back again.

I succeeded in doing this, even though it wasn't easy.

I managed to break out of this gray world.

It's been a long time since I've been in the Pipe District, but I still remember every corner here.

Nothing has changed here.

Discard 1 Morphing .

Relocate to any space in the Dreamscape.

Gain 1 ether .

1079.text:
A huge figure, a hulk made of muscles and anger, crawls from under the stone.

It drags a large scythe behind it.

The sturdy armor flakes off and the figure noticeably grows younger.

Scars seem to disappear and its muscles grow smaller, leaner.

Then his mask slips off and surprisingly reveals the joyful face of a young man.

His gaze seems far off though, seeking an elusive woman's voice.

Part of us hopes he'll succeed.

Time runs forward - or maybe backward? - and the youngster turns into a child, then turns into a messy chunk of flesh, only to disappear into a blank slate full of possibilities.

We're sure we'll meet him again.

Each Dreamer gains 1 ether .

Keep the "Newcomer" token, but place a block token on it - you can't use it again in this Dream.

1080.text:
We stare at the puppets with cold unmoving eyes - we become both an embodiment of threat and steely calmness.

They become still, obviously paralysed with fear.

They start retreating slowly and, finally, they're gone.

We realised we were so lost in staring at them that we didn't notice the passage of time.

Lose player Hours .

Victory.

This Slumber ends.
